text:
**4/5 Stars**

I recently visited Bistro Bliss, a cozy French-inspired restaurant in the heart of the city, and had a delightful dining experience. The moment I stepped inside, I was struck by the warm and inviting ambiance, complete with soft lighting, rustic wooden accents, and a lively atmosphere.

The service was top-notch, with our server, Emma, being attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. She made excellent recommendations and ensured our glasses were always full.

The food was the real star of the show, with each dish expertly prepared and presented. I opted for the Bouillabaisse, a rich and flavorful fish stew originating from Marseille, and it did not disappoint. The portion was generous, and the variety of seafood was impressive.

My companion's Steak Frites was cooked to perfection, with a tender and juicy cut of beef served with crispy, flavorful fries. The accompanying sauce added a nice depth of flavor to the dish.

While the food was exceptional, there were a few minor drawbacks. The menu could benefit from a few more vegetarian options, and the prices were slightly steeper than expected.

Overall, I would highly recommend Bistro Bliss to anyone looking for a charming and delicious dining experience. With a few tweaks to the menu and pricing, I would easily bump up my rating to 5 stars. As it stands, I would still return and try more of their dishes.

text:
**3/5 Stars**

I visited Bistro Bliss last night and had a decent dining experience. The atmosphere was cozy and intimate, with dim lighting and comfortable seating. Our server, Emma, was friendly and attentive, but seemed a bit overwhelmed at times.

The food was the highlight of our meal. I ordered the grilled salmon, which was cooked to perfection and had a nice char on the outside. The accompanying quinoa and vegetable dish was flavorful, but slightly overcooked. My companion's burger was juicy and well-seasoned, but the fries were lukewarm.

The menu had some unique options, but the prices were a bit steep for the portion sizes. The total bill came out to be around $60 per person, which felt a bit excessive for the quality and quantity of food.

Overall, Bistro Bliss is a solid choice for a date night or special occasion, but it's not worth breaking the bank for a regular dinner. With a bit more attention to detail and portion control, this restaurant could easily earn a higher rating.

text:
**5/5 Stars**

I had the absolute pleasure of dining at Bistro Bliss last weekend, and I'm still reeling from the exceptional experience! From the moment we walked in, the warm and inviting atmosphere enveloped us, setting the tone for a truly unforgettable evening.

Our server, Rachel, was a gem - attentive, knowledgeable, and genuinely enthusiastic about the menu. She expertly guided us through the extensive wine list, recommending the perfect pairing for our meals. The service was prompt and discreet, allowing us to fully immerse ourselves in the culinary delights.

The food, oh the food! Each dish was a masterclass in flavors, textures, and presentation. The pan-seared scallops were tender and succulent, with a subtle sweetness that paired beautifully with the tangy lemon butter sauce. The filet mignon was cooked to perfection, with a rich, savory au jus that complemented the dish perfectly.

The highlight of the evening, however, was the decadent chocolate lava cake. Warm, gooey, and indulgent, it was the perfect ending to a truly exceptional meal. The portion sizes were generous, and we left feeling satisfied but not stuffed.

Bistro Bliss truly deserves its reputation as one of the top restaurants in the city. The attention to detail, commitment to quality, and genuine passion for food and service shine through in every aspect of the dining experience. I can't wait to return and try more of the menu!

The hostess seemed overwhelmed and took an inordinate amount of time to seat us, despite the restaurant being half empty.

The menu read like a laundry list of overpriced, uninspired dishes. I opted for the "signature" burger, which arrived looking like it had been sat out for hours. The patty was overcooked, the bun was stale, and the "toppings" were an afterthought. The "fries" were straight from a bag and tasted more like cardboard than potato.

Service was abysmal. Our server seemed put off by our presence, taking ages to refill drinks and ignoring our requests for refills. When I politely asked for a manager, I was met with a dismissive attitude and a half-hearted apology.

The atmosphere was lacking, with dated decor and a playlist that seemed to be stuck in the early 2000s. The only thing that didn't disappoint was the check, which was mercifully small considering the subpar experience.

Unless you enjoy being ripped off and served subpar food, I'd avoid Bistro Bliss at all costs.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Bistro Bliss, and I must say, it was an unforgettable experience. From the moment we walked in, the warm and inviting atmosphere set the tone for a fantastic evening. The decor was modern and chic, with a cozy fireplace that added to the ambiance.

Our server, Rachel, was attentive and knowledgeable, taking the time to explain the menu and making excellent recommendations. The menu itself was impressive, with a variety of options to suit every taste. We started with the charcuterie board, which was beautifully presented and packed with an assortment of cured meats, cheeses, and accompaniments.

For my main course, I opted for the pan-seared salmon, which was cooked to perfection and served with a side of garlic mashed potatoes and steamed asparagus. The flavors were incredible, and the portion was generous to say the least.

My companion's dish, the filet mignon, was equally impressive. The tender and juicy meat was cooked to his liking, and the accompanying cabernet reduction added a rich and depthful flavor.

To top off the meal, we shared the chocolate lava cake for dessert. It was rich and decadent, with a gooey center that was simply divine.

Overall, our experience at Bistro Bliss was exceptional. The food was outstanding, the service was top-notch, and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a special night out.

text:
**1/5 Stars - A Disappointing Experience at Bistro Bliss**

I'm still trying to wrap my head around the utter disappointment that was my recent visit to Bistro Bliss. From the moment we walked in, the service was lackluster. Our server seemed overwhelmed and took ages to take our orders, and when she did, she got them wrong. We had to wait another 20 minutes for her to correct the mistake.

The food was equally underwhelming. I ordered the signature dish, the "Blissful Burger," which was overcooked and dry. The patty was small and lacked any discernible flavor. The "toppings" were a sad excuse for a handful of wilted lettuce and a few slices of tomato. The fries were cold and soggy.

The atmosphere was the final nail in the coffin. The decor was tired and dated, with flickering candles and a lingering smell of stale air. The music was too loud and played the same tired playlist on repeat.

Overall, my experience at Bistro Bliss was a complete letdown. With subpar service, mediocre food, and a lackluster atmosphere, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. Save your money and go elsewhere.

text:
**5/5 Stars**

I had the absolute pleasure of dining at Bistro Bliss last night, and I'm still reeling from the incredible experience. From the moment we walked in, the warm and inviting atmosphere set the tone for a fantastic evening. Our server, Emma, was attentive, knowledgeable, and made excellent recommendations.

The food was, without a doubt, the highlight of the evening. I opted for the pan-seared salmon, which was cooked to perfection and melted in my mouth. The flavors were expertly balanced, and the presentation was stunning. My companion's filet mignon was equally impressive, with a tender and juicy texture.

The wine list was extensive and reasonably priced, with a sommelier on hand to offer pairing suggestions. We enjoyed a glass of their house Chardonnay, which complemented our meal beautifully.

The service was top-notch, with Emma checking in regularly to ensure everything was to our liking. The restaurant's commitment to sustainability and locally sourced ingredients is also commendable.

In short, Bistro Bliss exceeded my expectations in every way. If you're looking for a special night out, look no further. I'll definitely be back!

text:
**3/5 Stars**

I recently visited Bistro Bliss, a quaint restaurant in the heart of the city, with high hopes and a growing appetite. The ambiance was cozy and inviting, with dim lighting and comfortable seating. Our server, Sarah, was friendly and attentive, taking the time to explain the daily specials and make recommendations.

The food, however, was a mixed bag. I ordered the grilled salmon with quinoa and roasted vegetables, which was cooked to perfection but lacked a certain je ne sais quoi. The flavors were muted, and the quinoa was overcooked. My companion's burger, on the other hand, was cooked to his liking, but the patty was dry and the bun was stale.

The real disappointment was the dessert menu. We opted for the chocolate lava cake, which was more like a dense, dry brownie than a rich, gooey delight. The presentation was lacking, and the portion was small for the price.

While Bistro Bliss showed promise, it fell short in several areas. With a bit more attention to detail and a tweak to their recipes, I'd be willing to give them another try. For now, I'd recommend it to those who prioritize atmosphere and service over culinary excellence.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Bistro Bliss, and I must say, it was an exceptional experience from start to finish. The moment we walked in, we were greeted with a warm and inviting atmosphere, complete with soft lighting and a cozy decor that set the tone for a wonderful evening.

Our server, Rachel, was attentive and knowledgeable, taking the time to explain the menu and make recommendations. The menu itself was impressive, with a wide range of options to suit every taste and dietary requirement. We opted for the seasonal vegetable soup to start, which was creamy and flavorful, and the grilled salmon for main course, which was cooked to perfection.

The food was truly exceptional, with each dish expertly prepared and presented. The flavors were bold and well-balanced, and the portion sizes were generous to say the least. We also appreciated the attention to detail, with small touches like fresh herbs and edible flowers adding a touch of elegance to each dish.

The service was top-notch, with Rachel checking in regularly to ensure everything was to our liking. The staff were friendly and efficient, making sure our glasses were always full and our plates were never empty.

Overall, I would highly recommend Bistro Bliss to anyone looking for a special night out. The combination of exceptional food, attentive service, and cozy atmosphere makes it the perfect destination for a romantic evening or a night out with friends. With a rating of 5 stars, I can confidently say that Bistro Bliss is a must-visit restaurant in the area.

text:
I recently had the pleasure of dining at Bistro Bliss, and I must say, it was a truly delightful experience. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with a warm and inviting atmosphere, complete with soft lighting and cozy decor. Our server, Rachel, was attentive and knowledgeable, taking the time to explain the daily specials and making recommendations.

The menu offered a wide range of options, from classic comfort food to more adventurous dishes. I opted for the pan-seared salmon, which was cooked to perfection and served with a flavorful lemon butter sauce. My companion's burger was also a hit, with a juicy patty and crispy bacon.

The real standout, however, was the dessert menu. We shared a decadent chocolate lava cake, which was rich and indulgent, and a refreshing lemon tart that was the perfect palate cleanser. The portion sizes were generous, and we left feeling satisfied but not stuffed.

The only reason I'm not giving Bistro Bliss a full 5 stars is that the service was slightly slow at times, and we had to wait a bit for our food to arrive. Additionally, the prices were a bit higher than expected, especially for the smaller plates.

Overall, however, Bistro Bliss is a wonderful spot for a night out or special occasion. The food is delicious, the atmosphere is cozy, and the service is top-notch. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great dining experience. Rating: 4/5 stars.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Bistro Bliss, and I must say, it was an absolute delight! From the moment we walked in, the warm and inviting atmosphere enveloped us, setting the tone for a fantastic evening. The service was impeccable, with our server, Emma, being attentive, knowledgeable, and friendly throughout our meal.

The menu offered an impressive array of options, and we opted to share a few dishes to get a taste of everything. The Burrata appetizer was creamy and divine, with the perfect balance of flavors and textures. The Grilled Salmon was cooked to perfection, with a crispy crust giving way to a tender and flaky interior. The Pan-Seared Scallops were succulent and rich, with a subtle sweetness that complemented the accompanying sauce beautifully.

The real showstopper, however, was the decadent Chocolate Lava Cake. Warm, gooey, and indulgent, it was the perfect way to cap off our meal. The portion sizes were generous, and we left feeling satisfied but not stuffed.

Overall, Bistro Bliss exceeded our expectations in every way. The food was exceptional, the service was top-notch, and the atmosphere was cozy and inviting. We can't wait to return and try more of their delicious offerings.

text:
**3/5 Stars**

I recently visited Bistro Bliss, a cozy spot in the heart of the city, with high hopes for a delightful dining experience. The atmosphere was indeed charming, with a warm and inviting ambiance that set the tone for a pleasant evening. Our server, Rachel, was friendly and attentive, ensuring our glasses were always full and our plates were never empty.

The menu offered a variety of options, but I was drawn to the seasonal specials. The Grilled Salmon with Lemon Butter Sauce was a highlight, cooked to perfection and bursting with flavor. The accompanying roasted vegetables were a nice touch, but slightly overcooked. My companion's Steak Frites, on the other hand, was a bit of a letdown – the steak was overcooked and the fries lacked seasoning.

While the food had its highs and lows, the real disappointment was the service. Rachel seemed overwhelmed, taking an inordinate amount of time to take our orders and deliver our food. When we asked for the check, it took an additional 10 minutes to arrive.

Overall, Bistro Bliss showed promise, but fell short in a few areas. With some tweaks to the service and attention to detail in the kitchen, I'd be happy to revisit and give them another try. For now, I'd recommend it to those seeking a cozy atmosphere and decent food, but not necessarily exceptional service or culinary expertise.

text:
**3/5 stars**

I visited Bistro Bliss last night with moderate expectations, and while it didn't blow me away, it was a solid dining experience. The atmosphere was cozy and intimate, with dim lighting and comfortable seating. Our server, Rachel, was friendly and attentive, refilling our drinks and checking in regularly.

The menu offered a range of options, from classic comfort food to more adventurous dishes. I opted for the pan-seared salmon, which was cooked to perfection and had a nice crispy crust. The flavors were good, but not particularly complex or memorable. My companion's burger was also well-made, with a juicy patty and crispy bacon.

Where Bistro Bliss fell short was in the presentation and portion sizes. The dishes looked a bit sloppy and uninspired, and the serving sizes were smaller than expected. The prices, too, felt a bit steep for what we received.

Overall, Bistro Bliss is a decent option for a casual dinner, but it doesn't particularly stand out from the crowd. With a bit more attention to detail and value for money, it could easily become a favorite. For now, I'd recommend it for a solid, if unremarkable, meal.

I recently visited Bistro Bliss, a cozy restaurant in the heart of the city. Overall, my experience was decent, but not entirely impressive. The ambiance was warm and inviting, with a rustic-chic decor that set the tone for a pleasant meal. Our server was friendly and attentive, taking the time to explain the daily specials and make recommendations.

The food was where things started to falter. I ordered the grilled salmon, which was cooked to perfection, but lacked a bit of seasoning. The accompanying quinoa and vegetable dish was flavorful, but overcooked. My companion's burger was cooked to their liking, but the patty was slightly overworked, making it dense and dry.

The real disappointment was the dessert course. The chocolate lava cake was cold and lacked the gooey center I was expecting. The portion size was also small for the price.

In conclusion, while Bistro Bliss showed promise, it fell short in several areas. With a bit more attention to detail in the kitchen, this could be a truly exceptional dining experience. For now, I'd give it 3 stars and recommend it for a casual, mid-range meal.

text: I was impressed with the beer selection, but the food put it over the top. If you're a meat eater, I can recommend the bison burger. It was delicious! And they will cook it medium rare. The apple chutney is a great touch on the burger.
label: OG

text: Another great beach along with Clearwater and Siesta Key on the West Coast of Florida. The sand was about the same with Clearwater but less smooth and powdery than its kind in Siesta Key Beach. One of the good things is that it was closed to Tampa Bay Area so that we can hang out more often as we would like to avoid the super crowding Clearwater Beach. The wave was gentle and small which was suitable for sea bathing but not so ideal for surfing. There were not so many services rather than restaurants and pubs. The street parking was free after 7:30 p.m. weekdays. A small but beautiful beach town to walk and enjoy the ocean atmosphere.An excellent place for relaxation, hanging out with friends, chilling in the winter, and watching the sun set below the horizon
label: OG

text: My fiance & I were looking for a caterer that delivered incredible food and wasn't your typical sit-down meal. From the very first meeting, I knew we had found the right fit with Birchtree. Rasa was able to customize our menu based on our travels around Australia & Southeast Asia. Not only did she make our ideas come to life, she elevated all the dishes to a new level. It was hands down the best food we've ever had at a wedding.Jenna has an unbelievable eye for design and the decor was wonderful. She took rustic chic to a new level. From the floral bouquets to the string lights to the hand written chalk boards, she brought the whole wedding to life. I still don't know how she was able to pull it off. I can't recommend Birchtree enough - the team is outstanding from the food (Rasa) to the design (Jenna) and everything in between (Allegra). All of our guests were impressed with the details and the personalization Birchtree was able to provide. Thank you for making our wedding day so memorable!
label: OG

text: This is very nice place to go and have a rest. I tried their quiche and it was very good! Our waitress was very nice. Just I didn't get refile for my coffee. She didn't come while we were eating our meal. She was nice. I think she need to practice lil more)) This was my first visit, and I'll think carefully about visiting this place again.
label: OG

text: I was realllly excited for this place to open. I walked by day after day waiting for when I'd be able to try their soups, salads, and sandwiches. When that day came, I was largely unimpressed. The sandwich was just ok and kind of skimpy. My soup was actually pretty darn good, but I found the entire meal to be overpriced for what I received. The sandwiches overall are kind of uninspired; I can pay the same price and get a delicious one at DiBruno Bros a few steps away. I hope they are able to rework the menu a bit because I'd really like to love this place.
label: OG

text: I really like this place and was surprised by it.  I have wanted to visit it for awhile and took advantage of an instant deal as I was downtown for work and hungry.  It was a good choice.I ended up ordering the Frank blinchiki and the Yummy Pelmeni.  The Frank was a hot dog (2?) wrapped in a thin pancake with tomato, lettuce and onion, "Chicago" style.  Excellent.  The Pelmeni are meat filled noodles that were so full of flavor (and slightly spicy) with a nice broth and topped with seasonal greens (also excellent).  While I only had water to drink they do have a focus on craft beers I believe.  The space here is the kind of place I would like to meet up at, really liked the interior and it felt very roomy.   The food (Russian influence) was not what I expected at all and was very unique and it is hard to surprise me.  I will be looking forward to going back and it will be hard not to order the same thing, it was that good.  The menu has something for everyone.  I heard someone asking about a trivia nigh but not sure of the details.   They also have board games handy I am sure for anyone that wants to play one.Definitely check this place out.  Friendly service also.
label: OG

text: My favorite place in Philly! very small menu but EVERYTHING is amazing! I love the Yakisoba bowl with lamb sausage! I get it crispy.Great ambiance - cool art - nice bathroomGreat servers and amazing ingredients!
label: OG

text: Stopped in today to get my 15 yr old daughters eyebrows "did". About a 5 minute wait and they did an excellent job, my princess was very happy. Prices very reasonable, Staff is fully licensed by Dept. of Business & Professional Regulation. . Will def go back.
label: OG

text: They used to be one of my favorite restaurants in conchy but the customer service has truly changed. I took my brother there for his bday after he suggested we go someone else. I told him how amazing this place was and he took a chance. The amount of conving I had to do boy oh boy haha. We're seated and one of the popular servers who I love gives us water & im thinking tonight will be perfect! But I was sadly mistaken. Our server was an older woman who seemed nice at the beginning but wasn't nice at all. We ordered drinks; those came out right away. Our server asked if we were ready to order appetizers and dinner ; my brother said yes but I was still on the fence. He wanted mussels and because they are all you can eat I stated we'd share. She said we couldn't share so I said okay no worries I'll order something else and try one or two of his mussels to see if I wanted to order that since tas an entree since I didn't have a big appetite. She became pissed she instantly began telling me there no big difference and all this other nonsense so I told her go ahead and put in my appetizer and his mussels as an appetizer in the mean time while I figure out what I want for an entree. 25 freaking minutes later after badgering the bartender politely of course to check on our appetizers because our server was so involved in her big party table that we clearly didn't matter & from then on the shitty service continues. The worst part is my Bf asked me not to say anything to the manager & to do it another time.  So I did the next day & was promised they would fix it & offered me a gift card to come back. 1 Month later; I'm guessing spending $200 at a Resturant I thought prides itself on customer service didn't care to follow up with correcting our experience. Don't even waste your time going here.
label: OG

text: Hey guys, thanks for slamming down the corrected plate of my friend's food on our table. We couldn't tell you were pissed at us for actually speaking up about the crappy service  Umm, some of the food was ok, but all in all it was inconsistent. Things came out at different times. Some food was hot, other food wasn't. One person's entree was spicy when we speciFically asked for it not to be spicy. They forgot my fries. Guacamole was not fresh. Margaritas were just... not good, not fresh. Like the bottom of the barrel. Manager didn't seem to care and acted sarcastic. That is the ethos of this restaurant. Save your time--save your money. Go somewhere else if you can
label: OG

text: Fresh and Great food. Service was excellent. I like the idea that if you can't finish your bowl becomes a takeout. Nice touch. My wife and I really enjoyed this place and will definitely come back.
label: OG

text: Met here with a few coworkers after a long day at the office for dinner and a few cocktails.  As mentioned in other reviews, I will say that the service is spectacular on every level.  The bartenders were engaging and made a good cocktail, and when we got our table our server was on point with everything from questions about the menu to making sure our waters stayed full throughout our meal.  The reason for the 3 star review is, unfortunately, the food.  I don't know what it is, but everything on this menu is salted to the point of no return, and I'm a girl who loves salt.  Just too much to handle in everything I tasted from appetizers to entrees.  The banana desert was spectacular though.Otherwise, it was a very pleasent experience and would return for happy hour or to give dinner another shot, in the hopes that i was just there on an isolated bad night.
label: OG

text: Since Mike's Ice Cream moved to their new location on 2nd Avenue, the service at this place has been horrible. The counter clerks are cocky and unfriendly. They put out a non-welcoming attitude and never say hello to guests. This store's ice cream may be good but it is no reason to be stuck up. The employees here give Nashville a bad impression with visitors and locals alike. Fix your attitudes and be appreciative of the business people give you. Stop being like jerks.I and some other locals have started referring people to Savannah's Candy Shop for ice cream because of the rudeness at Mike's Ice Cream shop.
label: OG

text: I can't believe I've never eaten here before! So good!!!! An extremely pleasant experience with delicious,fresh food, I will definitely be going back. We had pan fried dumplings, Mexican roll, soft shell crab, and sweet and sour chicken with donuts for desert.  Deeeelish.

text: Muriel's is an extremely nice environment with a very beautiful dinning area.Okay, now onto the food... WOW, best meal I've had in a while. I had a tomato that was unbelievable! And the duck was fantastic 5stars all day

text: This was a great find! Thank you for the recommendation Yelp! It has a fabulous donut selection and the menu was very unique. The wait staff were wonderful! Atmosphere was energetic and clean! The coffee is to die for!!! Black, Rich, bitter and flavorful!

text: Fast paced yet calm and easy to follow.  A great workout and unique experience with a very friendly staff.  Seeing as how this was my 1st yoga experience I was apprehensive, but I enjoyed the class so much that it is now part of my tucson routine.

text: GOOD PEOPLE! Always clean, attendants onsite, fix broken machines quickly, donate to our community, offer several services, have detergents and needed items on hand, fairly easy parking lot. The prices are fair. The owner Lesli is awesome with a big heart!

text: Awesome. Awesome. Awesome. We are so LUCKY to have found this place! We stumbled upon it after asking a local for a recommendation of somewhere to eat locally. A super cool atmosphere, great service and GREAT food! The mac and cheese is served in a skillet and VERY good! We also loved their true southern sweet tea (hard to find in Maryland!!). Highly recommend this place.

text: Run by very rude Asian lady who does not speak English and only point fingers. You can not touch anything in this store. Plus it's expensive.

text: Raul was professional, took his time to make sure he did exactly what I wanted, offered great advice and pulled out all the stops. Very affordable as well. I will be back.

text: This place is great!  They're always bumping good tunes, have Free Wifi, and delicious Meads (Not your standard mead... think amazing, then carbonate it and put it in a glass, that's what they serve up here!)... They also have a few snack options.The staff here is VERY friendly and they're Local!  New Day was the first stop I ever made in Fountain Square a year ago... I had such a great experience that day which even influenced me moving to the area!  If you haven't been here yet... YOU ARE MISSING OUT.
label: OG

text: We travelled to Nashville with ten friends for my wife's birthday.  We called all around the city, and Americano was the only restaurant that was willing to take a reservation for a group of twelve, without a pre-fixe menu or a strange dining time (like 9P).  Since our group was from several states, we wanted one chill, sit-down dinner together that wasn't on the fly.Luckily, we are huge tapas fans and, frankly, a lot of the food in Nashville is similar (southern/BBQ), so this gave us a chance to switch it up.I only mention all of the above because Americano was SOOOOO accommodating and friendly.  George (the owner) and David (the waiter) were absolutely amazing.  David personally thanked all of us personally for coming in and it couldn't have been more heartfelt.  I love helping small businesses that appreciate the business.Anyway, the food was spectacular.  I had sangria while others had other drinks.  Everyone was very happy.  We ordered LOTS of food for the twelve of us.  The plates were the tuna poke tostadas, ceviche, the chopped kale, the Brussel sprouts (tasted like vegetable candy!), shishito peppers, flank steak, pintxos de camarones (shrimp), and two paellas.  We also had flan and chocolate cake.  All the dishes were amazing, but I particularly loved the tostadas and the Brussel sprouts.We spared no expense and kept ordering, but overall the bill was very reasonable for what we got.If you are from out of town and want to make sure you have a reservation, this is a great restaurant.  If you are a couple living in town wanting a change in food and a romantic night, this is a great restaurant.  I wish this restaurant was in Massachusetts where I live!  Between the food and the southern hospitality, it is a great spot.
label: OG

text: Oh, hey!  That is a really cute dress.  Goes into the dressing room, my dress is a shirt on me.  Alas, this store is not my favorite place to search for casual dresses because of my height.  However, the accessories at Blush are modern, super cute and afordable.  I even like how they stock local designers.  It is always great to have an option to support local artists outside of festivals and such.  This place is on my list for cute gifts for my mini friends!
label: OG

text: The classes I took with Chef Bond were the highlight of my recent trip to New Orleans.  If you are looking for a "cooking school" that is all demonstration, packed with 20 or more people, this is not for you.  If you are looking to actually learn something real, from knife skills to history, you MUST go here.  The food you make (and I mean that- Chef guides and instructs, but you prep, cook, and plate) is restaurant quality, but reproducible at home.  I simply cannot say enough good stuff about it.
label: OG

text: I was hooked ever since I starting following Mac Mart on Instagram a few months ago but didn't make it out to the store until today. It's a small place with limited seating so I took my order to go. The menu was a bit overwhelming but I played it safe and ordered the Rittenhouse, which is basically a scoop of spinach dip on top of the original Mac and cheese, topped with breadcrumbs. Overall, it satisfied my immediate need for mac and cheese but it definitely wasn't the fresh, cheesy, gooey dish I hoped for. The pasta itself was a little too al dente and the cheese tasted like processed cheese. Personally, I like Panera's Mac and cheese better but the toppings make this option more appealing. Oh, portions are heavy so I recommend sharing an order!
label: OG

text: I came running to Theresa when I needed my bridesmaid gown altered. She assured me I will have it ready in a few short days and I can definitely say I was not disappointed. The dress fit me better than I hoped and I can safely say that she saved me from wearing an uncomfortably long dress! I would definitely recommend her services to others!
label: OG

text: OMG. If you love #matcha or green tea, then DEFINITELY get the matcha galore!! It was so delicious!! I don't usually like matcha anything because they taste so strong but this was perfect and mild. I think it's so cute they add the little koala cookie as their logo, brings back childhood memories! I loved the atmosphere and various options for you to choose! Come here when you are done with your day bc the line goes out the door!
label: OG

text: I went here with my boyfriend for Valentine's Day with the intent of wine tasting, but we ended up purchasing a bottle and a large cheese platter instead. The tasting is only $6 per person and the staff members all seem very knowledgeable. I am no wine connoisseur, so I thought the wine tasting would be a good option. However, after I told the staff member what I was looking for, she recommended me a red wine that was only about $17 a bottle. After tasting it, I wanted more and ended up purchasing the bottle. The cheese platter came with four different cheeses, salami, grapes, and olives. We had a lot of fun chatting with other visitors and enjoying the rustic atmosphere. Lots of room to sit and stand. I will definitely be back for their brick oven pizza and to explore the vineyard more when it is warm out.
label: OG

text: I am so unhappy to write this review but I feel like I have to in order to change the situation! I went to Sephora for the body sunscreen and when I asked sales associate to show me some, she was looking around for some time and finally she pointed to the face SPF saying that that one is the best. Very confusing! It is so hot outside, but they don't care. How hard it must be to remember where is the hottest products are. Especially that the girl that assisted me is working there forever (I remember her from my previous visits)  Very disappointing! I like Sephora for variety of choice, but today I realized that the word experience is not equivalent to the number of years you do something!!!!  I ended up finding all sunblocks myself and getting one. No thanks to anybody there! And I knew what to choose cause I know ingredients but what about regular people?! I will go there again for sure but not going to bother asking for help. It would be great to create some educational program for sales associates.
label: OG

text: Jackson's is all about the crowds that it draws; it's not about the service or the food.  I ended up there for lunch yesterday (it wasn't my first trip there and it won't be my last) because the line at Pancake Pantry was too long.  The food is average at best - I had the Ahi Tuna sandwich, which was overseasoned and dry.  I wouldn't order it again.  I have had good food there in the past.  But, the food is pretty hit or miss.  The service seems to be stretched thin, and unable to accomodate the large crowds they draw.  Don't expect quick service.  The atmosphere is pretty good, I do enjoy their patio.  This place is better than two stars, but there's not quite enough to earn that third one.
label: OG

text: Went for dinner the other night. It was my second time there. Both times I was unimpressed by our food. Chicken parmigiana was average at best. Fettuccine  Alfredo had good flavor but the chicken was full of gristle. My mother ordered risotto, it was well cooked but not impressive. Don't think I'll be back unless with a group and I can't persuade them otherwise.
label: OG

text: As for convenience, it's great. Jazmine's has a good mix of sushi and non-sushi cuisine. I can only speak to the sushi side, but it is pretty good, but it's not remarkable like some of the other more trendy places in town.The one note of caution is that if you have a food allergy, make sure you notify them right away and ask for a separate plate. If you don't, you will never know what you're getting into as 2 of the 3 times we've been, no one explains what was on our platter and we had to ask. This should be a no brainer for a sushi place/server (it happens at the bar at every place I've been from the sushi chef).It's close to work and home and the service is okay. We usually go during lunch time during the week (work lunches) and the service has been hit and miss. It's typically right after the first order and getting the check that are of issue. Be careful ordering the 'face'. It's delicious, but it's actually a side of a fish face (the cheek)! It is one dish that I would definitely order again, but not with AYCE.
label: OG

text: I forgot to start from the beginning! Lol so I got the German Pancakes and this is all that's left. The entire plate was covered with 2 big shredded potato German pancakes. Crispy enough. It's served w Apple sauce or sour cream not both. It was so good! We had the open face turkey sandwich also. But it was devoured before I got out my camera! Biscuit & gravy were good- a humongous fluff biscuit! We liked it. We were heading someplace else but the name is cute and the diner was nostalgic and clean. We totally liked it. -the service was extremely slow, I suppose to a busy time to eat. Or they'd get a 5 stars.
label: OG

text: I was really hyped to go here, and it ended up from being completely different from what I had in my head. I always picture Mexican cuisine restaurants as small, dark, and intimate. Revolucion is the opposite, airy, bright, and open.  I really loved the decor, fantastic bold colors and dark outlines like a kind of Cezanne meets Mexico. Adorbz. $3 Tecate sold me on beer selection. When at a Mexican restaurant, I prefer Tecate over anything, even the fine craft beers on tap. My friend had a margarita that looked like it was just mix, and with the temperature of the interior, melted in about five minutes. I had the fish tacos due to the recommendations of my fellow Yelpers, and they were super fantastic. I guess I was expecting salsa to come with it, particularly a green or other kind of light salsa. The mango mixture was a nice touch, but did not help to add to the moistness of the taco. The salsa that came with the chips was out of this world, and gone by the time the food came. The guacamole was yummy, but came out really, really warm. I very much disliked the quesadillas. There should be a disclaimer on the menu that the quesadillas give you the feeling like when you accidentally suck ocean water up your nose......so extremely salty that one was more than enough. If salt is your thing, eat these. I really liked this place, it's a cute idea. I just wasn't sold on the restaurant as a whole, there were definitely great elements, but things that really needed work too. I'm glad there was a friendly staff, this definitely sets Revolucion apart from many of its FS neighbors in my opinion. I'll be back, because tacos are my second favorite food.
label: OG

text: We had a great experience here! We had the spinach pasta, which was fresh spinach, mushrooms, tomatoes and onions with bowtie pasta in olive oil... delicious and cooked all dente! The salad was also fresh and loaded with variety. You have to purchase bread and there is no dipping oil, it was a bit disappointing. Reasonably priced wine by the bottle. Service was friendly and efficient. Atmosphere is nice but could use Sinatra music, not 80's pop! Not authentic Italian but fresh and delicious. We we will come back.
label: OG

text: Pizza is gross.  People working there are rude.  New to the neighborhood we tried this place. We were just moving in and explained this.  They charged us for utensils.  You would think they would welcomed us so they would have new customers. We go to old friends who are Much nicer.
label: OG

text: Serious false advertising, only came because of the "smoking" policy, planned to meet a few fellow cigar smokers and have a good time, nice spot, plenty of huge smoke eaters...cigarettes only!...WTF???
label: OG

text: We visit this spot every time we go to New Orleans. During our last trip, our 9 year old animal activist came along, even though we knew finding something on the menu would be tough for her. We were seated underneath a large animal head and she became dramatic and said she wouldn't eat here with that "animal staring" at her. I was just about to beat her ass when our server, Ritchie Rich came to the rescue and covered the animal head with a towel. She was pleased and no beating transpired. The whole restaurant cheered. Ritchie also brought her a plate of fruit that was off menu. The food is incredible and consistent every time we visit. Thanks Ritchie, for saving me from jail time.
label: OG

text: This place is awesome. Clean, great decor, great people alan's the food was perfect!Harriet our waitress was lovely.The staff broke out in song mid- meal, they all help each other out and seemed to enjoy working there. The food came out super fast and the menu has all the normal breakfast fare with several unique options as well.UPDATEWe've been coming back regularly and today we waited 1 hour 10 minutes for our food to come out after ordering.That's not the end of the world but for one detail:The kicker was that the owner ( maybe he was a manager?) sat down next to us with his food and even told us our food would be out shortly. No apologies from anyone.The food was as always, great.We're hoping this was a fluke but the owner(?) was so disrespectful.
label: OG

text: I go here when my mom doesn't cook but 1 thing I noticed that they've over charged me twice and since then, I always make sure I get a receipt. I'm actually shocked that they ask you if you want a receipt when you should be given a receipt automatically. Make sure you get one!
label: OG

text: To fellow Yankees fans: this hotel does the trick if you're in town for Yankees Spring Training. Big parking lot. Walking distance to GMS Field. Many, many other fellow Yankees fans stay here. Hotel is comfortable. Decent sized room, pretty comfortable actually, and clean. Breakfast available. Patio, pool, and jacuzzi available. If you're in town for something other than Yankees Spring Training, I'm sure you can find a nice and better hotel in a more prime location elsewhere in Tampa. But for the purpose of Yankees Spring Training, this is the closest hotel and a good home base. GO YANKEES!!!!!!!!!
label: OG

text: Last minute decision to come to Luke and a good one too =)The meal:Assiette de Charcuterie - I love charcuterie so I was completely sold when the server said they made their own. I was a little disappointed that they didn't have any cheeses to go with the meats but I guess that's not the norm. Overall, they were all tasty but I wasn't completely wowed by any of the items. Nice presentation though. Etouffee of Blue Crab & Brown Shrimp - This was not a traditional etouffee and I definitely liked it better this way. It was basically like a very creamy rich pasta with lumps of blue crab and large succulent shrimp. This dish looks small but it's so filling. Overall, I had a great experience at Luke. I'd like to try a full dinner here.
label: OG

text: The salsa and guacamole is. Made fresh daily. The chips are home made as well. The shrimp burrito was huge but was tasty and fresh. The wait staff was just average. Another great lunch!
label: OG

text: I can admit that I am an avid Fringer!I love the Fringe. And it gets better every year.All the shows are listed on the website (which wasn't the best this year), but you can also purchase a program for $10 that lists all the shows. You can buy your show tix online or at one of the many box offices in the Fringe area. There is also a discount tix booth on the North side of the Fringe grounds where different plays are discounted each day. If you are a big Fringer, I would suggest purchasing a Fringer Pass (10 show tix for $100) before the Fringe as it is a better deal than paying $13 a show plus extra surcharges. As well, keep an eye out for promo codes and coupons that may be lingering around.Make sure to subscribe to their newsletter for all the updates about the festival and shows. Also, they have holdover shows the following weekend of the Fringe. You can also just check out the Fringe shows to see some free outdoor shows, peruse the shopping stalls and grab some snacks at a food truck!
label: OG

text: I hosted a baby shower for my friend at The Parlor.  The event far exceeded my expectations.  The food was served family style which was a nice change from standard shower table service.  The food was exceptional and the service fantastic as well!  The staff and manager are excellent!  I would recommend this for a shower or lunch or dinner!  I do suggest having the roasted cauliflower and the butternut squash pizza!  We served the house wine which was a great value and tasted great!  Thanks again for a wonderful event!  I look forward to returning again!
label: OG

text: Gateway to India earned every single one of those 5 stars! I have tried Indian food in multiple cities across the country (Houston, Austin, San Fran, New York, etc...) and I have never experienced something this delicious before. We had a group of 5, so we ordered a variety of things (guided by our friend who had eaten there several times). The cauliflower appetizer is not to be missed. You should also have the black lentil dish from the Vegan menu (even if you aren't vegan). The lamb korma was mouthwatering, as was the chicken tikka masala. So much goodness in one place!!Now, even though the food was fantastic, I would not have given five stars unless the service matched. Thank goodness it did! Our host (I say host because we were treated like treasured guest in a home) was attentive, friendly, and made great suggestions on the food and wine pairings.If you don't go here, your life will never be truly fulfilled.
label: OG

text: No Dogs allowed. They have not been allowed for a couple of years now. No longer real reusable plates either.  The new deck area with a fire pit for warmth is for adults only and the indoor eating is tiny. We all still like it - a great place to catch a bite with the family, but thought you should know in case the things I mentioned matter.
label: OG

text: I heard they were chosen for Biker Bar Makeover on the Travel Channel. Not sure what it looked like before, but definitely reminds me of a biker bar now. Friendly crowd. Great band playing. Great prices on drinks.
label: OG

text: I have finally achieved my Envie dreams and squired my check in cookie. As I sip on my weekly Chocolate Au Lait (hazelnut coffee and chocolate milk) I feel a sense of serene victory for being a dedicated customer. As I bite into the Raspberry White Chocolate Cookie I understand what the founding fathers felt when they signed the Declaration of Independence. The taste of freedom rippling from my lips into my tongue. The huge luxurious chunks of chocolate liberate my sweet tooth and the raspberry pieces give added delight to this dish. I have discovered a new ritual for my Sunday diversion.
label: OG

text: This bridge is in a tough spot....on the one hand, if you're traveling east on it, that means you're leaving Philadelphia!On the other hand, it also means you're going to New Jersey.    It's nice that there's no toll going to Jersey.I've always had smooth sailing over this bridge so I can't really knock it.
label: OG

text: Pizzeria Vetri was so delicious! My daughter and I have been wanting to try for a while, but since they do not take reservations and we live outside of the city it's be tough. The hostess was very nice and welcoming, as was our waitress Madalyn. She was great with any questions we had and was super friendly, even giving us a complementary dessert. The ambiance of the restaurant was pretty casual, but comforting and lively with the music and wrap around bar in front of the pizza oven.As for our pizza order, we started off with the Melanzana pizza, which was amazing. The thin crust with tomato, eggplant, and stracciatella was a perfect combination! The pizzas are probably a little larger than your average personal pizza, but cuts into 6 slices. We could have stopped there, but we had to try another pie. We went on to have the Salsiccia pizza, which had fennel sausage, roasted fennel, tomato, and mozzarella. If you are looking for something other than your typical Margherita, both are sure to satisfy. I would definitely recommend Pizzeria Vetri!
label: OG

text: We visited based on Yelp reviews and they did not disappoint!  Regular order of pancakes came with eggs and bacon - plenty to feed anyone. Specialty omelette with shrimp and mushroom sauce was excellent. Attentive service too. Highly recommend!
label: OG

text: First the good- Beautiful interior. Great beer and drinks. Good separation of the bar from the dining room. Now the bad- Poor value for dollar spent. French onion soup, one of my favorites for evaluation, super salty, thin broth with two tiny slivers of onion not even up to Campbell soup quality. Fries mealy and barely warm. Sandwiches thin and needing more meat. Kitchen slow and server kept forgetting items ordered. Kids meals only thing somewhat on point but even they said fries were iffy. On first visit we always order from the middle of the menu and we were glad not to waste too much money. I suggest the manager actually try the food for freshness and quality. Might open their eyes. Otherwise a good spot for meeting and drinking. Eat elsewhere.- Just a side note. While waiting for our food the couple next to us called the manager over and told him the food was terrible. This was mid-meal. One of them paid and just left. Should have been our heads up of what was coming.
label: OG

text: I was in earlier tonight with my friend and my son for a mushroom & swiss burger which was great and cooked perfectly. The food is always great, but the exceptional part this time was our waitress, Katrina. She was very attentive but most of all she was wonderful and very patient with my son, who is a bit of a talker. We had a great time and will be back again soon.
label: OG

text: Absolutely amazing! While in New Orleans and walking around Magazine St my group and I decided to pop into District Donuts and we didn't regret a thing! When we walked in there was a small line that moved very fast. Getting up to order there was an array of donuts on display to choose from. I went with the White Chocolate Raspberry donut and a black coffee. We found an open table and started digging it. Hands down one of the best donuts I have ever had. Between the group we all sampled each other's and they were all amazing. The donut itself was very fluffy and not too dense. The outer edges of the donut were crispy. The frosting was the exact flavor that it was supposed to be. Of course the donut was very sweet and only one person was able to finish theirs (they are pretty decent in size), it was a fantastic find! Throughout the rest of the trip we found ourselves wanting to go back but we knew we had to try other restaurants on our list. All in all, good atmosphere, great food! Would highly recommend and I plan to return.
label: OG

text: I came here for brunch with a large group of friends- and although I did not eat any of the food, it all looked delicious coming out.They did a great job accommodating our large group and many requests for champagne. Service was spectacular.  We were able to sit outside and enjoy the beautiful weather, but the vibe inside was really cool and I look forward to coming back and enjoying drinks at the bar.
label: OG

text: I want to give this place 5 stars really because of the sweet lady that works at the counter. I haven't been here in so long that things have changed from tokens to card. I didn't get her name but she helped me walk through with how things work and showed me around. My 3 year old son was so thrilled to play with the arcade games. It was his birthday so I wanted to take him out, even though I'm planning to do his party on Sunday at home.
label: OG

text: I went in for a trial run before scheduling multiple services on a day out with mom, and I had Ashley for an aromatherapy massage. She was wonderful! I have some previous major neck/back injuries and Ashley talked through all of them BEFORE the appointment, so she would be up-to-date and be able to spend more time on my massage. I always make sure to point out a couple of places that I have issues with, but this was the first time a masseuse actually remembered where those places were without hitting them first. Someone else noted it to, but the post-water process is a bit awkward. They give you this nice little glass of water... as you're being sent out to the register to pay. Of course, they say they'll meet you out there, and I'm sure that's what they mean. But if that's their intention, it would be nicer if they just gave you a bottle for the road. I didn't try their other services out, but the set-up is nice. Their packages are reasonably priced so I scheduled a mani-pedi/massage/facial (Soothing Package) for the end of the semester with the mamsters. Hopefully it's just as good the second time. FYI: For massages (and I'm not sure about other services), you AND your friend get a $15 gift cert for every friend you refer. Pretty sweet deal :)
label: OG

text: This is the best breakfast in Clearwater!!  Reasonably priced, everything was great!!  Even my two picky kids ate all their breakfast!!
label: OG

text: This is hands down the worst McDonalds I have ever been to. While I do not fault the establishment for the unsavory characters that hang out in and around it (a given considering its location), I do fault it for the extremely negative attitude of its employees. None of them make even a minimal effort to hide their annoyance at the mere presence of paying customers. They act as though you are ruining their day by politely ordering food and paying for it. The only reason I gave two stars instead of one is because the nuggets and fries were decently fresh. I understand that working at McDonald's in a place like that is probably nobody's dream job, but if you can't have an positive attitude in that job, don't expect to end up with anything much better as your life goes on.
label: OG

text: I was really pleased with our meal here.  So tasty, yet so darn healthy - and the atmosphere was friendly and relaxing.  We arrived late on a Sunday afternoon, about 3:30 pm, to get an early dinner.  The lunch menu was being served, but that was fine as there were still plenty of choices.  The place is quite small inside, but still has an appealing atmosphere.  Since it was such a nice day, we sat on the side/rear patio in some shade.  The patio, too, is appealing.  It has character from the old part of town location, and a front gate/fence that provides privacy and reduces street noise.  Some other reviews have talked about service being professional yet cold with the latest ownership, but we didn't experience any of that.  I know it was our hostess' first day, and she was excited and bubbly.  Our waitress too was conversational, checked on us frequently, kept drinks filled, and kept dishes cleared.The food itself was excellent.  All very fresh, as Mediterranean-style should be.  I especially noticed how fresh the herbs and garnishes were, and then later saw the four large herb garden bins on the patio.  No wonder - much of it was being grown on site.  Our meal items included Moroccan Olives, Israeli Bruschetta, King of Kings hummus, and chicken meatballs.  There were a lotta lotta olives, which was great.  All of them were pre-cut around the center, making it easier to eat the olives and get the pits out.  Bruschetta was fantastic.  The blanched/peeled tomatoes and pepper/garlic/mint spices exploded with flavor in each bite.  King of Kings hummus was also top notch, and the bread was nice & warm.  They were generous with the pine nuts and almond pieces, and I really enjoyed that extra nuttiness.  They give you a lot of hummus, too.  The chicken meatball dish was quite good overall, but I would have liked more spiciness in the meatballs themselves.  The dish included tatziki and a chickpea & pepper salad under the meatballs.  Those parts were flavorful.  It didn't seem like a whole lot of substance to the dish for $18 - I would have preferred more meatball and less other, but it wound up being enough overall.  In fact, we were both stuffed after eating all the items - I think the volume of hummus and chickpea & pepper salad did the trick.
label: OG

text: I like nachos. Most red blooded Americans do.  Good nachos pretty much separate good Mexican restaurants from bad ones.  El Gallo grande has great nachos.  I had the fajita nachos and they did not disappoint.  They also had a 2$ taco happy hour of which I tried and got what I expected, a cheap no frills soft taco.  The menu also includes all your normal chimichangas, relleno peppers, enchiladas, burritos etc.  Good selection of beers and margaritas. One of the best parts of this restaurant is the ambience created by the authentic decor which makes you feel as though you were sitting in a cantina in Mexico.  I would highly recommend this and will be returning again next time I am craving some really good nachos!
label: OG

text: salmon was fresh. the hotpot with fish eggs was not good. pho noodle soup was terrible. melons were not fresh . if u like shabu shabu, the dinner will work for you. otherwise try $11 lunch.
label: OG

text: Love their bakery.  Had a fun time looking, selecting and tasting their fine Epiphany assortment.
label: OG

text: Finally!we have this in our area.A MUST go if u haven't yet!They make the "rolled ice cream" in front of u.Its quite pricey but its worth it
label: OG

text: We've visited New Orleans at Christmas for 20 years and just found Dizzy's this year!  Food is wonderful, atmosphere even better. To the person who posted a comment about updating the place, I pray they don't!  It is small and informal and perfect just like it is!  We went on Saturday, and in a city known for good food, we had to come again for more before we left on Friday!  We were surprised to be waved to a table by the lady who had taken such good care of us a week earlier saying "Well you DID make it back - you think I don't  remember?!", and remember she did, right down to what we had ordered before. If you're smart you'll try the jambalaya omelet, the grits, the fried chicken, and the mac and cheese; if you're LUCKY, you'll have Miss Lucey taking care of you!  Ask for her!!!!
label: OG

text: This has become our new favorite spot especially for sushi! Very clean and delicious food. Can't beat the price $10 unlimited for lunch and $17.95 unlimited for dinner. You will never leave hungry.
label: OG

text: I have been impressed with the service and the workers at Mister. I am always greeted with a smile and my car comes out shiny looking like new. I'm not usually a fan of car washes that use the "giant pasta noodle" method but it seems to do the job. Like all car washes, the work is done by people and people aren't perfect. I took off one star because of details that they have missed that could have been done if they were a little more attentive or if they spent another 30 seconds wiping down my car. Not really a big deal, just things that I notice that I do when I wash my car myself.  Like for some reason, they can't figure out my floormats. In 10 years, this is the only car wash I've used that can't put my floormats back in the proper spot. And they somehow destroyed the little rubber teeth that hold the mats in place. I get in my car and find all these little rubber teeth on the floor. Not a big deal, just annoying
label: OG

text: You guys.  You don't know me like that, so I have a confession to make.  Deep down...I'm kind of a crunchy ass hippie.  Like, I fantasize about vegetarian co-ops (what up, Rainbow Grocery!).  So, in this meat and cheeze addled town, Essene is a welcome respite.  I love cruising the aisles of healthy people food, reaching out to veggie sandwiches.  And the hot bar.  Ohh, the hot bar.  So many delicious vegetable creature dishes.  I can't remember which ones I've had just now, but I imagine that they involve leafy greens.  Aaand there's a cute area to eat inside.  Aaand their staff is generally adorable and/or comforting in appearance.Yes, it's expensive and I can't really afford to buy much there, but just knowing that's there's a whole refrigerator full of raw prepared food out there makes some days worth enduring.  Also...I really enjoy mock chicken salad, and they have no less than five kinds.  Nom nom nom.
label: OG

text: I always enjoy my burrito, but the tables, chairs, and floor in the dining area are always dirty and disgusting. The area is small and it's not appetizing or welcoming to have to sit in filth while you eat. It's not acceptable to have to clean your own table. This hasn't been a one time issue - it's literally every time I've been there. If they're busy or whatever, they still have to employ enough people to have someone on cleaning duty. It doesn't matter how good the food is, once you see the dining room with crumbs and food and garbage from the table down to the floor, you lose your appetite and start to question the quality of your food. If they leave the dining room in that condition, how does the kitchen look??  Not okay. Needs to be fixed. Won't be back until then, and won't recommend until then. Qdoba's dining room is always spotless and inviting. Clean up, Chipotle!
label: OG

text: Amazing, Amazing, Amazing!!!! We stopped in around 12:45pm on a Tuesday for something sweet and my wife and I were very pleased. We ordered the Cinnamon Roll and the Strawberry Cheesecake Donut. They called our order very quickly and the deserts were so good!!! Great Place!!!
label: OG

text: Over the years I've used national, regional and small local movers for personal and business moves. G&G Moving, Inc. provided the BEST service I've ever received. Here's why:1. Prior to the move, Owner Vernon Gibson asked lots of detailed questions about what we were moving, how it was packed, etc. so that he could properly quote a price and estimate the time it would take.2. He priced per job --not per hour. Very, very reasonably priced.3. Professional -- Provided me with a folder detailing everything about the move and included the invoice. Showed me how organized he is.4. Careful -- he and crew took care with all my items. Treated everything as if it was fragile!5. Went above and beyond expectations. I had a piece of furniture that was broken, he fixed it!I highly recommend G&G Moving -- they will move people and goods from anyplace.
label: OG

text: Absolutely fell in LOVE! I was visiting Philly for a few days and asked around for a healthy food option and was pointed to Essene! OMG! The customer service, food, cleanliness and available products were all AWESOME! I've shared the website with others, and can't recommend the cafe enough! You'll love it!
label: OG

text: I've been going here for years and enjoy the Pasta House.  The food is always great, the portion size is good, the wait staff is great (very friendly and accommodating).  This is somewhere between casual dining and family dining.  The atmosphere is a bit loud for my taste sometimes (it is a kid/family friendly establishment, and the noise level is in line with that), but all in all, I would recommend the pasta house to anyone for a good meal at a good price.
label: OG

text: Absolutely refreshing after some poor experiences in Edmonton. A quaint comfortable room with informed professional wait staff that works together. The main attraction, the chef and his wonderful cuisine. Beautifully prepared Lamb loin with tender succulent prawns, seasoned Bulgar and expertly roast vegetables with a tasty cacik (I believe). The greens and spinach were of the freshest I've had in a while, expertly prepared and marvellously dressed. the handmade in shop baclava should be sampled and I would recommend the turkish coffee (no cream).A truly remarkable repast.Thank-you
label: OG

text: Such a fantastic experience at the Lowe's Hotel these past few days. My company got a group of about 15 together for business meetings yesterday & today with colleagues from NJ, NY & PA, so we all arrived at different times via plane, train & car. We arrived yesterday morning for all-day meetings in one of the private conference rooms at the hotel & stayed the night at the hotel. From arrival to departure, the service from the staff here was exceptional.David, the bellman, greeted me outside before I even had 1 foot out of the taxi. He took me straight to the check-in counter.Jamie & Emily at the front desk assisted with my check-in and were SO cheerful and friendly! Duc, one of the food banquet guys, was my favorite of all. Since we were in the Anthony Conference Room on floor 3 for business meetings, we had catered lunch, drinks & snacks from the hotel. Duc was super attentive to our needs, came to refill waters & sodas from the table, set up the lunch table, & I was convinced he was psychic. Every time one of us would look around in need of something, Duc just had the uncanny super power of knowing what we needed (location of restrooms for example). Duc is awesome!!!The rooms were HUGE, super clean, nicely decorated, new appliances & the soap products smell SO good. The bed was probably the biggest bed I have ever slept in. I should have slept horizontally to fully utilize the bed space. Fresh flowers in the lobby and a very pleasant experience upon arrival and every time we would walk through the lobby. The hotel was busy with other similar professional work groups in town, & the downstairs restaurant & bar (bar is called Bank & Bourbon) was unexpectedly quite the attraction of the lobby area. Even if you weren't staying at the Lowe's, I would highly recommend getting a drink at this bar. Friendly bartenders too. You're doing great work here, Lowe's! Looking forward to staying here again the next time I'm in Philly!
label: OG

text: Was on the way to one of my fave Pho spots in New Orleans when I saw this Mexican restaurant across the street. Was a bit hesitant at first since I hadn't heard about it before, but I love Mexican food, especially authentic, so I gave it a shot.A sexy mamacita in a Mexico soccer jersey, with two gold fronts served me some camarones a la diabla with a sweet smile. Felt like home. I think she purposefully added extra food to my plate...everyone else's plate didn't seem to hold that much food. If you're reading this, thank you mami. I ordered a steak taco as an appetizer since I always try the tacos at every Mexican restaurant I go to.. Although it was quite delicious, and hit the spot before the main course, I wish I didn't, because like I said, their serving sizes are huge. The triple threat would be going here, them hitting up Wit's Inn for a Wit maker, then back across the street to Angelo Brocato's for ice cream. I only gave this place 4 stars because if I could have gotten a margarita after my dinner, it would have been a 5 star experience, but unfortunately they don't serve alcohol.
label: OG

text: I used CJ Muggs as the venue for my Rehearsal Dinner in the beginning of April.  They have a small-ish private room (held 50-55 very comfortably) in their basement, which made it intimate and quiet for our guests!My guests cannot stop saying how good of a time they had.  The food was prompt and tasty (those potatoes!!), the drinks were flowing and we had the room for the rest of the evening so there was no rush!  The service staff was very welcoming and accommodating.  Sam, who I dealt with the most reserving the room and picking out the menu, was on hand to make sure things were running smoothly and then sent a very sweet thank you e-mail after the event.The price of the room reservation (free!), food ($17 per person) and drinks ($12 per person) made this the best choice for my guests and budget!  Thank you CJ Muggs for the perfect middle ground between providing my guests with a great meal and not hurting my wallet!
label: OG

text: Beautiful cigar store. Three sections as described in other reviews.  Merchandise (lighters, humidors, pipes, etc) up front.  Cigars in the.middle and a smoking lounge in the back.  Started smoking in the lounge (no longer BYOB friendly since they opened Ashton's Cigar Bar upstairs)  but several people in the back lounge were having a robust, somewhat loud conversation so I moved upstairs to the Ashton Cigar Bar.  Prices for cigars are reasonable for B&M locations downtown Philadelphia.
label: OG

text: i've been going to school in SB for quite some time now and I haven't been the largest fan of seafood, but my roommate forced me to come with her and I can't deny the fact that the food here is amazing. I don't even remember what we got, but we had a very large variety and practically everything was scrumptious
label: OG

text: Dinner was prepared to perfection. Server was attentive. Management is on top of everything, taking time to come and inquire about our needs. Will definitely return soon.
label: OG

text: Boyfriend and I went on Halloween night, hoping restaurant would not be packed, and luckily that was the case - they were about 80% full the entire time we were there.  Service was excellent and we felt all the food came out at appropriate times.They have a huge whiskey selection and a large selection of sodas, some housemade.  Their beer selection, however, is small and odd.  I ordered a Ward 8, one of their whiskey cocktails, and loved it.  Boyfriend was excited to see Busch beer on the menu, until they told him it was in cans, so he ended up just drinking iced tea.We started with the Biscuits and Breads $8 appetizer, which consisted of one of each of the following: a fluffy biscuit, a flat biscuit, a square of Yankee cornbread, and a wedge of traditional cornbread.  The traditional cornbread was our fav.  You then select 3 of the butters/spreads from the list - we selected the molasses-pecan butter, burnt orange marmalade, and strawberry-blueberry jam - liked them all but the jam was the best.  It was great for 2 people to share, and would also be easy for 3-4 people to share as each person would still get at least 1 bite of everything.We ordered the whole fried chicken, planning to take some home.  The pieces were large and cooked perfectly.  The breasts are boneless and cut in half.  It is heavily seasoned, which we liked.  They have hot sauce on the table, but we didn't use it.  The whole chicken is expensive at $34, but they are large, antibiotic and hormone free, raised humanely, etc, so I'm not surprised by the price.We ordered 2 sides - the Jailhouse Cole Slaw and the Mashed Potatoes and Gravy.  We liked them both and they were perfect for 2 people to share.  We did think they were overpriced, based on the serving size.  I'd suggest they increase the serving size a bit or reduce the price.There are two individual restrooms, both unisex, which is much appreciated by me.  Neither had a mirror though, I'm assuming they just haven't been installed yet.It was an expensive fried chicken meal - $70 for two people, including one drink, before tip.  As much as we liked it, it will just be a special occasion fried chicken place for us, probably only going once a year, due to the cost.  Things that would have made this a 5-star review:  better beer selection, cheaper sides (maybe cheaper prices in general).
label: OG

text: Great southern and soul food.  Wonderful service and good atmosphere. We had fried shrimp,  fried chicken, fried okra,  collard greens, Mac and cheese and sweet corn bread from the Owen.
label: OG

text: You MUST go to this sushi restaurant for the experience of the "Sushi Nazi." He's honest and will send you out if he thinks you are unworthy of his sushi (so we were told). The sushi is served in large portions and is incredibly cheap and delicious.
label: OG

text: Such a great froyo shop! We went here this past weekend. It was clean, the banana froyo was great and the guy behind the counter couldn't have been nicer. I would highly recommend this place!!! Plus the name....ughhh so clever!! :)
label: OG

text: I rated this place a 5 star in the beginning. There have been several instances with communication break downs and food arriving cold. Last time, which has led me to revise this review once more to negative, the the fries were put into a sealed spaghetti container with the tin foil lids so when they arrived they were so soggy and limp. As well as a new driver was sent out without change and forgot the pop. When I called to mention this? I was told that's just how the fries are. They are 4 mins from my place. There have been plenty of times the fries showed up in styrofoam containers and were so hot I couldn't eat right away. They did not care that someone who spends close to 300 a month on their food was just expressing the change in container and information for them. It's a shame too because this place does have good food. For anyone in the area I would not recommend this place. Also they close very early. I recently discovered laziza which has amazing customer service huge menu insanely huge portion sizes for the cheap prices and is only 6 mins from me in Castledowns. I strongly urge everybody to check them out next time you have a cravings for delivery. You won't be disappointed.
label: OG

text: Generally, the M Street restaurant family is not really my vibe. A little too slick and "cool" for my tastes when I go out. But I had heard different things about Moto and was anxious to try it. The space is lovely with big open windows to let the light in. Personally I would prefer to dine in the front bar area, but a bigger group might prefer the darker, more secluded booths in the back.My husband and I were meeting a couple of friends and arrived early to enjoy a cocktail at the bar. I love seeing a classic Negroni on the menu, and it was perfectly balanced, a nice apertif to start the meal. When we were seated, our waiter was attentive but gave us space to decide what we wanted. We started with the octopus and the pork cheek terrine. Both appetizers presented beautifully and tasted fresh.I ordered the spinach fettuccine with braised lamb, olives, and mint. The pasta was cooked perfectly, and the combination of the lamb, the saltiness of the olives, and the herbal character of the mint was delicious and unusual. I had bites of my husband's black spaghetti, which was also delightful. I can't wait to return and try some of the entrees as well. He also ordered the polenta fries, and I couldn't stop eating them!We split the Meyer lemon bundino, and it was just okay. I might skip dessert next time in lieu of just an espresso. The focaccia bread that was delivered was incredible, just about perfectly warm, fluffy, and great rosemary flavor.
label: OG

text: The team at New Orleans Urgent Care did such a great job at helping me get comfortable, through the process of xray's and to find out I broke my leg. The put me in a temporary cast, and gave me some pain meds to get me home. Thanks! Guys - I really appreciate the time you took with me!

text: This location is right by my work and so my co-worker and I visit frequently.  The past SEVERAL times, they have messed up the order when my co-worker orders for us.  Either they mess up our breakfast sandwiches or they mess up our coffees.  It has come to the point now where we are not surprised if they don't get it right.  My co-worker has pretty much given up on visiting this location - she has given them countless tries to redeem their selves and they have failed to do so. I went there this morning and ordered 3 coffees and they messed up 2 of the 3.  I called and they told me I can come back in and they will make them for me the way I ordered, but I am already at work so I will have to go back another day to get them.  This is a MAJOR inconvenience!
