text: This restaurant is located in the Warehouse District inside the Old No. 77 hotelWe had a delicious quick lunch before heading to the airport back to NYC :(Their biscuits & butter are seriously to die for and I'm not much of a butter person. Dee-freaking-licious! We started with the marinated shrimp & roasted jalapeno jus which was very light and refreshing. For entrée I had the drum with apples, collards & fennel and my husband had the butternut squash agnolotti with pumpkin seed granola and sage. We shared the soursop semifreddo which neither of us were a fan of but great presentation and again, light & refreshing.
label: OG

text: Great food., outstanding service! Came to visit my best friend who lives in Phoenixville and decided to go for Mexican food. We had been here before when it was under a different name., (can't recall the name) but this time the food was much better., more variety., they now have typical dishes from South America and Central America. I had the Argentenian Churrasco and the Tostadas and they were both excellent. My favorite were the Tamarind margaritas!! Out of this world! Angel the owner was so nice & professional, He came to our table more than once just to make sure we were satisfied with everything. Highly recommend it!
label: OG

text: I've been a loyal customer since 2009, there was a period where I didn't come as much when I moved to South Philly but I returned to dining here when I moved back to Fishtown in 2016. I've always had a decent experience, good margaritas and good food, the wait was never good but tolerable. Well tonight, 12/29/17, we asked for a table of 6, we were told 40 minutes wait time which was fine, we get it people probably had cabin fever and they were busy. We scurried to the bar area, congregated at the corner ordered drinks, even got a pitcher of margaritas. The bar servers were great. 70 minutes lates, we were finally seated. We got our appetizers, they were great then we ordered our entrees. Three of us got fajitas, 2 out of 3 were cold. One of three that was hot. But the hot fajitas had such a tiny steak on it. 2 of us did not want to complain, we weren't there to get free food but eventually one of our friend did say something. Our server, Ashley, was great and she got the manager. He solved the situation by getting me a fajitas that was hotter, the way it's supposed to be. He brought out another steak for my friend. The food runner with the pink hair dropped off my hot fajitas but the literally dropped the plate of tortillas, sour cream and guacamole as if she was bothered by our complaint in front of my friend. The Diva in me wanted to snatch her hair and scold her for her behavior but in the real world I had to keep it cool. I was so angry that I lost my appetite. I don't expect to be worshipped, that's not what I wanted but a good customer service would have been great. As a frequent diner, that's all you want. Good food and hot meal with decent service. Look, I'm not here to get free crap, I literally eat out almost every single meal. I know what's it's like to deal with customer complaints, I respect everyone and do my best to fix the situation since I've had a job dealing with food and people at age 16. The food runner with the pink hair could have remedied the situation by acknowledging the situation and not taking things personally or even the manager could have tried to understand but none of that was done. I felt bad for Ashley, the server but she literally did her best and try to make things better. It just sucks because I don't think I could ever get my friends to come back here again and I think I am done as well.
label: OG

text: The location was rather clean, and everything looked rather appetizing, but when I attempted to buy something, I waited for over 20 minutes while nobody acknowledged me, and I could see and hear them just gossiping in the back. It was probably just the night shift, but that was my experience.

text: Sad to say I could of tried dog food and it would of probably been better matter of fact my dog ended up with a $16 dollar steak take home cause it was mostly fat. text: Donuts were pretty good not amazing. Not as amazing for all the hype. I did not really enjoy the 2 that I had. All the guys in the office enjoyed them so that's what mattered.

text: Really scary at first!!  We arrived at the hotel and quickly found out the parking garage is around the block.  The garage is under construction and stairwell had vomit/urine/feces in it, not to mention a car with a busted window (glass all over the ground and in the vehicle).  The hotel needs a lot of updating when you first walk in so I was concerned about our rooms.  Renovation appeared to be going on on our floor but there was no noise.  Our king suites were super clean and had a coffee maker, small refrigerator, microwave, desk with office chair, tv, and table with two chairs.  The room had nice hardwood floor.  Not much of a window or a view but nice room and bathroom was very clean.  Breakfast was great and much better than the microwaved and basic food most hotels provide.  Eggs and omelettes made to order and a wide selection of food items.  Parking and breakfast are included.  There are servers so bring money for a tip.  The hotel has a nice office, game room, and gym.  If you need a late night snack or drink, everything you could possibly have a taste for is within a 3 minute walk of the hotel.  Italian, Mexican, sushi, Thai, calzones, pizza, steak house, and On and on.  The wine bar down the street was picked and lots of people walking around.  There is a big park two blocks away from the hotel with two playgrounds and a workout station.  Service at the hotel was nice and everyone was friendly.  I would stay here again, especially since it was so clean!!
label: OG

text: Great dog-friendly place to sit outside and have some beers and cocktails when the weather is nice. The food is uneven - fried green tomatoes need an overhaul - but the staff is friendly and helpful.
label: OG

text: I can't believe they're charging $10 to park!! Don't they get enough of our money already?? They've lowered themselves to the lowest of the lowest money-grabbing some balls. I can tell you one thing for sure. We will never ever be returning to this place. Biloxi is a drive up the highway, but I'd rather go there than EVER returning here. If I could give them no stars would. By the way, no hotel in Biloxi charges!! So if I want to throw my money away I'll go to Brighton. But if I want a decent chance of winning with FREE PARKING!!!! I'll go to Biloxi!!!!!
label: OG

text: I was born here and as a native of Tucson I get it a lot of people don't like it.  because of crime and gang members but you get that were ever you go. so finding something that you like may take time but you will find it and if you don't you can always move to New Mexico

text: Pralines and Peanut Butter!!Review my photos and you'll see that my wish-list line of sweets include peanut butter, peanut butter, and more peanut butter.  Yes, I love me some peanut butter and it wasn't until now, that I enjoy a good praline once in awhile too.  We stopped at Southern Candymakers not once, but twice, during our weekend stay in New Orleans.  This only means that we wanted more and more is exactly what I got. What to expect...-Southern Candymakers has entrances on both sides.  I prefer that you walk through the Decatur Street side. From there, you're immediately in line to the register.  Make up your mind quick because the line goes quick.  -The Selection...all sorts of goodness.  Chocolates galore!  As you get to the register, you'll get to the Pralines.  Some of the best pralines are found here.  -Pre-Boxed Treats-SouvenirsMy Selections:  Peanut Butter dominates my choices.  I'm sure the other chocolates were good, but it's all about the nutty taste of PB for me.  Love their PB Pralines, PB covered Oreo's, and the PB Pretzel.  All PB cups were a little too much for me to handle.-Peanut Butter Praline:  http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=uTva7BqdYwI3JfN8eY5OsA&userid=y3FcL4bLy0eLlkb0SDPnBQ-Peanut Butter Covered Oreo Cookies:  http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=jN748Nb2T6S-mletDtm8wA&userid=y3FcL4bLy0eLlkb0SDPnBQ-Peanut Butter Chocolate Pretzel:  http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=ELiAwzEGyDkvWPYxac0JOw&userid=y3FcL4bLy0eLlkb0SDPnBQ-Chocolate Peanut Butter Cup:  http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=3Yinlqhp2O-Hw5OO5VeSjw&userid=y3FcL4bLy0eLlkb0SDPnBQ-White Chocolate Peanut Butter Cup:  http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=Ch3Sm7fF-vBcjzosWb_DDA&userid=y3FcL4bLy0eLlkb0SDPnBQ-Peanut Butter Passion Cup:  http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=BFNVDZvRgAGHoi1QHkGj2Q&userid=y3FcL4bLy0eLlkb0SDPnBQOverall, I'm giving Southern Candymakers 4 Stars for service, selection of sweets, the abundance of peanut butter choices, quality, and taste.  The only thing keeping me from giving them 5 Stars is price.  $2.50 for one peanut butter cup?!?!  PS:  Read Terri R's review.  She's right, you are hit with the sweet smell of sugar.  You can even smell it from outside.  Need to wake up..try walking inside Southern Candymakers. If the smell of freshly made chocolates or peanut butter doesn't wake you up, then you must be made of stone.YELP PERSONAL CHALLENGE - (033/366)
label: OG

text: Super nice place and friendly staff. Competent chicken, but not the best I've had - by a long shot. That said, the whole package: fries, sauce, homemade dessert was worthwhile.

text: Not anywhere near as nice as most LA Fitnesses but it use to be an Urban Active that LA fitness recently bought out and they are making changes slowly but surely to raise the membership experience. 30 bucks a month isn't bad for all it offers. Basketball court, Spin classes, personal training, plenty of free weights, machines, and cardio equipment, dry saunas, punching bag and other boxing equipment. I played college football and have been in and out of the gym my entire life. It's not the best looking gym but that's irrelevant to me. I'm happy here at LA fitness and could see myself calling this gym home as long as I'm living here in the hermitage area.

text: I was eager to try Toppers after reading the pretty stellar reviews. My family ordered the Toppers Classic (pepperoni, Italian sausage, onions, green peppers with mozzarella and homemade pizza sauce) and a create your own (spinach, artichoke hearts, feta, black olives), both on thin crust. A large 14" pizza is $18.99, and they also come in 9", 12" and 16".Ordering online was a cinch and the pizza was ready to go when we went to pick it up 20 minutes later. I enjoyed our pizzas (my personal fave was the Toppers Classic), but neither were OMG ah-mazing. Their pizza offerings are more gluttonous (think mac n' cheese pizza and lots of BBQ/ranch concoctions) and I tend to like the "healthier" pizzas, like veggie lovers. A solid choice but not at the top of my list.
label: OG

text: This Starbucks is very clean, in a small and nice location, their service is great, the people here always serve with a smile. I came here to get coffee with my girlfriend and they make the coffee perfect every time that I have been here, I'll have to go back and put them to the test again, I know Starbucks isn't for a lot of people because they are a little bit higher than other coffee places, but I think the customer service makes up for a lot of the negativity that is given to Starbucks, give them a try and if their not for you more power to you enjoy!
label: OG

text: Libertine is an Indianapolis gem and one of the best places for a cocktail in the city.  The other reviewers are right- sit at the bar!  The bartenders are knowledgeable and skilled; they offer great drink suggestions to make your experience feel more personal.  Libertine serves up 5-star cocktails and under chef Neal Brown, the food is just as impressive.  The menu is extensive for a cocktail lounge, offering small plates if you're snacking or full entrees for dinner.  Last night I had the elote pappardelle: buttery pappardelle pasta with sweet corn, tomatoes, & cotija cheese.   It was unlike anything I've had before and so tasty! If you're looking for inventive cuisine and cocktails to sip and savor in a classy gathering place- head to Libertine. Bring your out-of-town guests. Bring a date. Be ready to be impressed and leave with a new favorite restaurant.
label: OG

text: The barbecue shrimp. The barbecue shrimp. The barbecue shrimp. Yes three times. It's that damn good. This dish is a dish you can dream about when you're far away and you want a yummy meal. When you reflect on your life and all the meals you had and all the bad ones you've had and all the good ones you had. And then one of those just sticks right out. It's the barbecue shrimp at Mr. B's. If you asked me today what meal would you like eat before you die. I would say this barbecue shrimp please... is all I need to feel blessed and enlightenment. It's become part of my flavor standards. Since my 14th year in this beautiful life here on earth. I have always cherished Mr. B's bbq shrimp Creole and people would look at me like I'm an arrogant fool for saying my favorite meal in the world is Mr. B's barbecue shrimp. And little do they know what they'r missing, little do they know how good it is, how yummy how flavorful, how juicy how crisp and just how poetic of a dish. God bless the man who created it and I can only recommend to every human alive out there reading these reviews try the shrimp and be enlightened.
label: OG

text: Absolutely delicious food! They have vegetarian options that are so good. Way better than Taco Bus and CLEAN!

text: I just ordered a burger from Plum Bistro via Uber eats. I just wanted to let everyone know that the burger was phenomenal! I never post on yelp. The burger was so good that it inspired me to type! I will definitely be ordering again. Thanks Plum Bistro!

text: We walked in through the courtyard entrance of Olio in the late afternoon on a Tuesday. As always, service made the lunch break go from great to exceptional, and we enjoyed every sunny, delicious minute of our time at Olio. We will be back for more and soon!

text: Yesterday made my second stop to Pancake Pantry and both visits have left me satisfied! There's a lot to love about this place, its cozy, unpretentious, and has an original Hunter S Thompson in the corner. The staff has always been friendly and efficient. Oh, and the food is awesome! My husband always gets the plain waffle and loves it. I have tried the pecan and blueberry pancakes and both are terrific, coffee is really good too. Prices are reasonable and portions large, I always leave here stuffed! We get there early and so far haven't had to wait. Free parking in the back.

text: Outstanding service. Driver was already there when I landed. He helped me with the bag and provided an excellent ride to my destination. He offered suggestions on local restaurants and places that are worth visiting. I will definitely use the service again!!! Highly recommended!

text: Was a waste of time and money. They are one of the worst Jamaican food I ever had other than Jamaica Ds. I don't understand why they have awards for this place. Maybe they use to be good. I order oxtail, jerk shrimp,Mac and cheese, and jerk chicken. The oxtail were very hard and the flavor was bad it probably was old the sauce was not fresh and it was sleep up on the plate. All they did was add browning to the meat. The plantains was the worst I had in my entire life it was not sweet it was hard and over cooked they didn't use a ripened plantain. The jerk chicken tasted old the jerk sauce was pure pepper. I know you hear chopping in the back but that's not what your getting.I know Jamaican food is usually spicy but this was not enjoyable spicy. It's nothing wrong with spice but damn they over did it. The Mac and cheese was so so nasty. First of all it was like they used the cheap blue box of Mac and cheese and than it must have been old because the noodles were all broken up like it was giving trouble coming out the pot. I even saw the lady scraping up something when the curtain blocking the kitchen from the counter was drawn away for a brief moment. My daughter did not even want it after she had her first taste. I wish I didn't eat I already had a bad feeling about it when I saw it. The jerk shrimp was not jumbo as stated and it was just drowning in jerk sauce that was overly spicy and they were very small like they were over cooked or just very small shrimp on white bread. We needed a lot of water and overall I think we had left overs and or maybe they just had a bad cook. I will never return to this place
label: OG

text: Best burgers on Media, fantastic selection on menu and quick service. Only two drawbacks are that they are currently closed on Sundays (which their message says witll change in September) and that they don't deliver!

text: Wow! I wish we had a place like this in our home town! It's probably good that we don't, since I'd be here every day for lunch... The menu has a wide array of sandwiches and wraps, and the hot bar was killer. The veggie wrap was exceptional, and my husband and I enjoyed the French onion soup. The market had plenty of eye-catching trinkets and home goods. Great place to dine and shop.
label: OG

text: As the name implies all the meats are cooked on a rotisserie which means your voices are somewhat limited to tri-tip and chicken. Both are very good and tender just as you would expect. You get your choice of sauces and we tried the spicy pepper and chimicurri. The chimi was delicious and fresh tasting and definitely our favorite. You also get a choice of two sides with the meat. There were a decent variety we both tried the roasted corn salad (fresh grilled corn with poblano and cilantro) and I had the mac and cheese and he had tater tots. The sides were fine. We were both happy with the portion size so that it didn't feel we were drowning in food. Once we initially got service they were prompt and attentive. Prices were pretty low for the quality of food which is always a plus. Overall it was a positive experience but food was alright and not memorable.
label: OG

text: Today was opening day and after a panicky scramble to find myself a partner in crime to share my buy one get one free burger deal & after waiting 45min in the rain next to a pair of cigar smoking self-proclaimed "thugz" who found it appropriate to yell at every passerby on the street with some sort of derogatory expletive...I finally was rewarded with the deliciously greasy but gourmet 500 burger experience!I got the 500 burger and I was not disappointed. It's a sexy looking burger - a little tall, plump with promise & bright with color.  While it looks small it is thick and dense. The meat is juicy and flavorful (aka there was a fair amount of grease/juice running out of each my bites). It comes on a brioche bun which was a bit dry... The 500 also comes with bacon and well you can't really go wrong with bacon ... ;) The special sauce was decent but nothing special. I would have liked to see some hot sauce offerings. Three types of fries - plain, spicy and truffle... Say No More! Truffle fries?! Yes please. They have milkshakes which I did not get to try but it's made with Bassett's so... again can't really go that wrong.... It's a small space with a few benches and bar stools to eat at. You go up to the counter, place your order and when your number gets called you pick up your goodies and chow! I hear this place is going to be operating some late night kitchen hours to rescue us from the late night, drunk munchies... But this is a rumor yet to be confirmed!All in all, good burger and worth the wait. I'll be back soon... tomorrow I think...
label: OG

text: So sick!!!  Staff was terrible and the produce tasted funky now I've been sick for 3 days!!!!!  I'm so sad because Quiznos was my favorite for years and I was so excited to have one by my house again!!

text: It had been a while since we have been here and since then, service had gone downhill quite a bit. The food was prepared poorly too. Mussles were overcooked and old avocado was used in one of my rolls. text: After finding this on a list of hot new places & seeing the glowing Yelp reviews the bar was set really high, and Compère Lapin mostly delivered. We had the conch croquettes, fried pig ears, and dirty rice arancini. Perhaps it's our fault for not realizing we were ordering three fried things, but the preparation was a bit plain, some fresh/crunchy veggies could have balanced out these appetizers. But don't get me wrong, they were tasty and we gobbled them up. The sautéed shrimp with roasted jalapeño jus was utter perfection. We finished with the goat curry with sweet potato gnocchi which was delicious but just a teeny bit off - the gnocchi just a bit too gummy, the curry not concentrated enough. I realize I am being nitpicky, but with the abundance of incredible food in this town I think little things matter. Overall I would definitely come back, there's so much potential in this Caribbean/Creole fusion idea!
label: OG

text: This is by far the best vegetarian place I've been to. The food is delicious and the service is great. I would highly recommend the Bistro Bella.

text: We had a short wait for a table and within a few minutes of sitting down, our waiter came over. He took our drink order and returned quite quickly with our drinks. He then took our dinner order and we told him we did not have any silverware. He said he would get it for us, so we waited... and waited. Finally he returned with our soup and salads and we again requested silverware as well as fresh grated cheese.He apologized  for forgetting the silverware and said he would be right back.He wasn't. We watched him wander around the restaurant until he was out of view. We sat for about 5 minutes while soups got cold waiting for cheese and salads could not be eaten without silverware. Finally, my friend got up and got us silverware himself.When our waiter came back to the table, he asked "how is everything?" we were appalled. We told him we had to get out own forks and never got our cheese. He apologized again and mumbled something about the hostess getting our silverware.Then our dinner came... because someone other than our waited delivered it. He did swing by and asked if he could get us anything, my friend wanted crushed red pepper. He said, he would bring it right over.He got lost again. Didn't see him again until we were finished eating.We noticed another employee bussing a table next to us so my friend asked him if he could get us the crushed pepper. He looked at us as if we had 3 heads, asked where our waiter was then refused to get it for us.Ok, so we didn't get our pepper....well, we also didn't get any more drinks. Our glasses sat empty on the table, sounds of our slurps against the melting ice, a lonely beer glass, empty.We chose Carrabba's because we wanted a relaxing night out and a good meal. It's not often we can afford to eat out so it's an occasion. It should be a good, stress free, relaxing time.... Not an evening rubbernecking for your waiter, thirsty and frustrated having to get your own silverware. This was not the first time something like this has happened to us at this Carrabba's. We had a very aloof waiter on our last visit, granted not as bad as our waiter last night. We will not be going back to Carrabba's for a while. Hopefully, in our absence, the staff will get some much needed customer service training.
label: OG

text: This small cafe in northern liberties is the best cafe ever. The food is delicious, the place is really comfortable and the owner is very friendly. The only bad thing that I can think about is the hours. The cafe is closed after 3 pm. So I can only go on the weekends. Well besides that the place is amazing. If you want a good hot chocolate and some alone time is definitely the place to go.
label: OG

text: The place is ok. Food is average what you would expect from a strip mall restaurant.  Out server was very nice but overall the place would not get a return visit. Sauce was bland and portions on the small side.
label: OG

text: I ordered the bird and pig with Asian slaw.. $10.   The sandwich is warm and pressed.  It has pulled chicken inside.  I was worried it would be dry.  IT'S NOT.  Very moist!  Thick cut bacon and thinly sliced green apple.there was also a mayo type sauce. .tasted a bit sweet...Boy was this sandwich great!!  The Asian slaw was delicately dressed with the careful handed use of sesame oil.   Fantastic!   And they have a large assortment of Florida brewed beers.  The Wynwood iPA was so flavorful and foam on top just pillowy.  Atmosphere relaxed.  Staff is friendly and service great.  I was here on a Thursday night about 6pm.  Nice and clean.
label: OG

text: Great ambiance and food. The cornbread is good and the feast for one it was very good.  Wife had the catfish which she didn't care for but the waiter quickly replaced it with the pulled pork.
label: OG

text: Not-so-happy hour! $1 off an overpriced red blend? Woohoo - I can finally afford that beach condo in Miami with these deals! And what's up with the $13 corking fee on a $12 twist-off that I bought from your store? Feel like tuna tartare? You can enjoy a flavorless can of tuna for $17 on the "happy hour" special with some stale Kettle chips. Your friendly bartender clearly skipped more than a couple dosages of his Lexapro because he will yell at you if you try to pull a chair from the bar to one of the tables... Less than thrilled with this overpriced ABC Liquor.
label: OG

text: Best happy hour in town!!! Great place to meet friends and dance your ass off. You have to try their Russian Dumplings, they call them Pelmeni. Sooooooo good ! Great back patio too.
label: OG

text: The food here is amazing. Lots of flavor, each dish built with wonderful fresh veg., delectable sauces, interesting and tastes specials. The dessert, shared by three, was Wiberg. Not too sweet and creamy! Organic decaf coffee freshly made.The servicer, Julia, was friendly and had recommendations. A great sense of humor and a smile. We had the Arancini appetizer, special of the night tacos with cauliflower with a lightly spiced carrot reduction sauce, a Blue Cobb salad and Fresco salad. Each was so tastes! Blueberry fool with lemon curd and a spiced cookie. Really good!
label: OG

text: 5 stars. Loved their pralines & other confections. They were melt in your mouth good & the staff was so friendly and helpful with samples. They were the perfect treat to bring back home to family
label: OG

text: What can I and that hasn't been written? The food is consistently wonderful as is the service. I've eaten at several Yats locations and had them cater a  party. Always excellent food!
label: OG

text: Nice little dinning experience. Stopped in for a drink and bite around 7. Quickly found a seat yourself table in a bust Valentine's night.  Service was good and love my filet bites. Will come come back to try their deserts. Cookie molten pie  and pb and j.
label: OG

text: This is going to be such a great memory of Florida. The ride over to the island with the crew was amazing, their hospitality truly shows how much they love what they do! The island is a beautiful place, and we're lucky to have experienced it!!
label: OG

text: This place is a JOKE. My family went there on a Saturday afternoon. The place was just about empty. There was no one to greet us for about 10 minutes.We were finally seated. We didn't see a waitress for another 15 minutes. Mind you, THE PLACE IS JUST ABOUT EMPTY! When no waitress came over the manager came and took our drink orders. I ordered coffee. Typically they bring a pot of hot coffee. The coffee was lukewarm and I barely got 2 cups out of it. Clearly this pot was from another persons table because a full pot of coffee yields more then a cup and a half of coffee. I watched as more people came in and waited to be greeted and seated. I also watched people walk out because they weren't greeted or seated. I watched in amazement as the manager and another employee were at the front of the restaurant and neither of them greeted several guests as they cam in. They just let them stand there while they continued talking. This manager is a light skinned or biracial woman with curly hair. She is horrible. She is the one that brought me the used pot of coffee. It took almost 1 hour for our food and again...THE PLACE WAS EMPTY! Our waitress was the only bright spot in the horrible experience. She was working several stations. I watched one waitress wipe the same 2 empty tables 3 different times. When our food finally arrived, the guy that brought it to use only had 2 of the meals. He looked at my sister and myself and said, "what did you have?" I will NEVER darken the doorstep of this establishment ever again. Whoever manages this place needs to be fired immediately. Get classier staff and train them. The staff looks like they just grabbed people off the street and threw aprons on them and told them to work. HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE!!
label: OG

text: I had a hot, fresh slice of chicken-bacon-ranch white pizza and it was amazing! Crust was just a little crunchy, not doughy or chewy. The toppings were tasty, big pieces of meat. I'd say the decor is nice enough to sit down with your family or a casual date. Did I mention they're super friendly? Free refills on fountain drinks. I'm definitely gonna try the gourmet sandwiches next time, there are 9 types, each named after a North East Philly neighborhood. The Philly themed mural is well done and contains local iconography, neat to look at. They should open a GOOD pizza shop like this in South Philly just like this one, we could use a fresh menu down there. Commonwealth Kitchen 2!
label: OG

text: My kids love coming here. We're from out-of-town but come to Tampa about 3-4x a year to visit my brother. We've done yearly passes every other year. The kids always ask to come, and love it as much as Busch Gardens.They have blocks, Legos, airplane building and launch center, small rock climbing wall, a free play indoor playground that is similar to an ant hill, firefighter dress up, water boats, and more. In the spring and summer months, I'll pack their swim suits and let them play at the water foundation/splash pad outside the building. There is also a fun playground right outside the museum, too. We spend on average of 3-4 hours in the area in total - with museum, water foundation, and playground. Sometimes there are special events in/outside of the museum, including outdoor ice rink in  the winter. Bring snacks/lunch and you can eat at the tables outside the museum. Parking garage (right next to the museum) is reasonable too. $7 for the whole day.If you're looking for something to entertain the kids, check this museum out. I've always been surprised with the low rankings here on Yelp, because my kids (4 and 6 years old) love it. Tip - if loud noises and kids screaming bother you, bring ear plugs!
label: OG

text: The carne asada taco was incredible but tiny, and I wasn't particularly impressed with the quality of the Sonora Hog Dog.
label: OG

text: Reality set in for me. Came back to earth, good for a brew pub, but still a brew pub. Last visit was ok to good. Food was good enough, maybe a little flat. Service was more the issue, certainly ok but not attentive. Some long waits to find server and we needed her. Plus starting out was a little rough, longer wait than expected. Tried again last night, noisy and crowded, no patio seating. Went elsewhere. Inside was a little rough from all the previous activity. Plus always freezing cold inside. Inside isn't for us. Every bit of 3 stars, just not more.
label: OG

text: Awesome place to see a show! It's the smallest venue I have ever been to but was great. You get up close with the band which is kick ass! We didn't get drinks for some reason. They did have cocktail servers walking around which is cool.The bathrooms are down a long narrow stairway which I am sure can cause drunk people to fall up or down. The three draw backs:1. the entrance is down an alley2. No chairs I like to stand for a concert but like the option to sit during lame ass opening bands.3. Parking. Now I am new to Reno so maybe we could have parked closer. We parked at Harrahs so it's not a far walk but we had to walk by some very very shady people. All in all it was a great place to see a show! Next time we will try to get one of the few seats I am told are upstairs.
label: OG

text: They used to have the worst jerseys (that powder blue just did not work), fans who booed a Hall of Famer (Mike Schmidt) and the most annoying player in MLB history and that was pre-betting scandal (Pete Rose and that bouncing the ball hard off the turf move he did after the 3rd out of an inning).Now they are one of the coolest teams in baseball thanks to a spanking new ballpark, a better look jersey/logo-wise and players who are fun to watch from Ryan Howard to Jimmy Rollins.
label: OG

text: I used to come here on Sundays for a delightful brunch with friends but I now refuse to. I've gone on other nights as well. It's just not good. The food is ok. The drinks are alright too. I used to love the sangria but on more recent visits, it's always seemed like something was missing. The wings are great, but not worth it when there are so many restaurants in the area. What really gives this place two stars is the lack of decent service. It's terrible! Every time I'm there it's terrible. Once I had a server make a mistake on my food and she said I'd have to pay for a new order. Why? I didn't mess up, you did! Her reasoning was that they aren't corporate so they can do what they want. Umm ok. I'm glad you don't care about your customers. I want to try it again. Maybe they've gotten better, but it's just so hard when, like I've already said, there are so many better restaurants nearby.
label: OG

text: Tried this place for the first time Friday night. I was a little worried about a long wait (Friday night prime time), but we were promptly seated. The staff was very attentive and prompt. Food was VERY good! Excellent dumplings and the Spicy Girl roll was one of the best specialty rolls I've had anywhere! I will be going back!!
label: OG

text: I posted on my facebook, "nothing in the world beats the feeling of eating a really good burger; feeling satisfied all thanks to Burger Up!" And I thought to myself that Burger Up and people need to know it. I love your burgers! They're great in taste and cooked exactly the way I order them. I cannot stop eating your house made ketchup too. There is so much to give this restaurant credit for. One last thing, customer service is great! Workers are so nice and they make you feel you're at home.
label: OG

text: My wife & I have been here several times & absolutely love it!  It's a great steak house for a nice evening out.The atmosphere is just the right mix.  Not too loud, not too quiet.  A bar is available while waiting for your table & all seating, from what I could see, were spacious, comfortable booths.  I was never a fan  of packing small tables close together  (i.e. cheesecake factory).The appetizers & food were incredible.  Several of their menu items are in daily limited qty's due to the preparation needed for these entrees.I can't vouch for their drink menu as I stuck to beer, but my wife said she enjoyed their wine selection.Prices were very reasonable for the quality of food.  Dinner for 2 (1 shared appetizer, 2 entrees & I believe we had 2 drinks each), was about $10 more, compared to that of one of the restaurant chains such as Longhorn's or Olive Garden.All in all, a great place for a night out that I look forward to returning to!
label: OG

text: I liked the fact that this place had such a diverse menu but still have to give it two stars.  It was late on a friday, they have outdoor seating which is great but my steak came over done.  (medium rare is not uncommon and I couldn't figure out how they messed that up)  The waitress brought our side dish pretty much after we had finished.  The wine was WAY overpriced.  And then when we got seperate checks she still ended up putting both tabs on my card.  Oh well.  Just could have been end of the night mess ups on the staffs part.  I wouldn't go back but if you go......get the mashed potatoes!  They were excellent.
label: OG

text: ABSOLUTLEY TERRIBLE!!! We ordered for pick up, the prices we not the same as they are their online menu(about $10 more for my order) the food was cold and OLD. The "Alex special" was probably the only decent thing we got but certainly NOT worth the $7! The devil crabs were old and cold,the potato ball was a joke,seriously a joke. All it was, was deep fried mashed potatoes topped with hamburger meat and the best was the plantains! 5 measley cold,burnt little plantains! When I called up there to tell them about this, the owner was beyond RUDE claimed they just made everything fresh(far from it) and never bothered to replace or refund my $30. I've been in the hospitality business for well over 8 years, I know how it all works and clearly this guy has no clue how to keep a customer happy! Needless to say, we will never go back. He's not even Latino pretty sure he's greek. Don't waste your money or time here, go to the Latin Cafe or The Latino Supermarket. Twice the food, FRESH and very friendly.
label: OG

text: On the surface this just seems like your typical bar but please take note that they have a legitimate chef serving up delicious Italian food.  Italian food in an Irish bar? You bet! All three of us thoroughly enjoyed our meals.  This place gets crowded on the weekends (it's a bar remember) and the dining room doesn't have much space wise but if you're around during a weeknight I would highly recommend giving it a go!
label: OG

text: My boyfriend stopped by this place from our drive from LA to SF. Based on the great reviews, we decided to give this place a try and I am so glad we did! Their food was amazing! The place is small so there is often a long wait list or crowd waiting. The servers quote about a hour wait, however the lines often speed through faster since there is a to-go window on the side. So if you have the time, I would definitely recommend this place. The place is constantly busy and their ciopinno, lobster and oysters were amazing. I would skip on the lobster taco as it was not as impressionable as the other dishes.
label: OG

text: Very fast delivery and the quality of the food was very good. Like some other reviews said doesn't have that old grease flavor you get at alot of Chinese carryouts. The beef lo mein was great.
label: OG

text: So many places to choose this looked nice. Plus comfy air conditioning inside to escape unusual warmth for October. Good band playing at lunchtime. Nice menu, lots of options.. burgers, salad, famous fir their huge nachos platter. Sit near the front and hear the band or way in the back ( as we did) where it's cool and relaxing.  Ordered the taco salad and my husband had a chicken sandwich.  Taco salad is excellent! Chicken sandwich good too! Glad we stopped in
label: OG

text: Everything is really good. I heartily recommend the Baleadas, Tortas, and Tamales! Good fresh flavors.
label: OG

text: OMG! This pizza is amazingly delicious. I read the reviews and it seems the Chicago style is the people's fave, so that's what I went with. I was skeptical because most Chicago style pizzas aren't fully cooked and gummy in the center. Not this one! This pizza was fire! Perfectly cooked all the way through. Premium ingredients. Loaded. I ordered the 10" with pepperoni, sausage, bacon, mushrooms, garlic, jalapeños, onion and bell pepper. I could only eat one slice. I am full. I am satisfied. And, I will be back.
label: OG

text: Yum! Talk about a really lovely margarita. A peach margarita made from FRESH PEACHES FROM THE FARMERS MARKET. My colleague Julie P also had a finely crafted drink. Scotch, whiskey, I can't remember, but it had a zing of yumminess which was perfect after a hot day of attempted scooter touring.Do give Burger Up a try. The name had me thinking it was some burger diner, but that's not the case. It's a modern/industrial cafe with uber fresh food and drinks.
label: OG

text: Great service and a peaceful dining experience. Service was excellent as was the curry cauliflower chicken. The paleo lasagna was excellent although unexplainably spicy. Hostess checked the spices in the recipe and none should have contained heat but it was hot. Not a problem for me since I enjoy a little spice but it was a surprise. They did offer to replace the dish but I was quite happy with it. In looking for a quite, healthy place to dine after a busy day this fit the bill very well. For those dining paleo or whole 30 or vegan I would highly recommend.
label: OG

text: This is a nice place to go for an intimate and quiet glass of wine to finish off an evening. It is romantic and as I said quiet.  Single glasses of wine are a bit pricey at around $10 a piece.  I guess you should expect that at a wine bar.The bottom line is this is a very nice place to go for some quiet time with your significant other.
label: OG

text: Well I dropped in here today first a lunch and the of fortunately it just didn't live up to the hype of the the the the drink was up was good and cold in fresh and reasonably priced but that the food unfortunately was a really quite overpriced for for what you get uh I ordered the other the lunch special fried chicken and it was $16 and "underwhelming".
label: OG

text: I ordered the breakfast wrap and a green tea bubble tea with popping bubbles. The green tea was delicious, I don't think I would ever want to order anything else!!
label: OG

text: It's hard to beat a neighborhood bagel shop. Although Einstein's is a chain, you might be fooled into thinking this spot is as unique as the Central West End neighborhood it calls home. Great selection of bagels, always solid. I have streaks for a month or so where I go here almost every weekend. Free wifi, great service, and a cool atrium on the side that looks out on Euclid and West Pine. Tip - the bagel clusters are delicious.
label: OG

text: Excellent service and food.  Dillon was very friendly and attentive on opening night!!
label: OG

text: Beds were extremely comfortable. We stayed in building 4 in a suite. It was a little out dated but clean and very spacious. The staff, especially Paris, was extremely friendly.
label: OG

text: Had an absolutely phenomenal dinner. Started with both the tuna tartar and carpaccio both A+. Followed with mussels in coconut curry - now on my top ten list of best things I've ever eaten. The 36 oz dry aged porterhouse was amazing both in taste and presentation. But if you don't save room for dessert you're out of your mind. You couldn't live with yourself for missing out on trying the apple fritters however the carrot cake was the best we've ever had by a mile.
label: OG

text: three muses was a gem!  it was within walking distance from the french quarter (give or take about 20 minutes), offered a drink AND food menu, had the sweetest/nicest bartender ever, and was small enough to make it a cozy space for listening to some live, local jazz.we took a peek at the spotted cat and dba before deciding on three muses because three muses offered a food menu that could be applied to the drink minimum.  i ordered the pistachio banana mascarpone strudel, which was just the treat that i needed for my sweet tooth, and my bf ordered a few drinks.  we snagged 2 seats at the bar so we didn't even have to wait for a table.
label: OG

text: From reading the reviews I thought this was going to be a great mom and pop restaurant. They increased their prices recently. I paid $8 for 2 chocolate chip pancakes that were smaller than an average size pancake I could have made myself. It is very outdated and the place mats were very sticky. It felt like one of the waitresses was rushing us because she was standing right on top of us the whole time and immediately took my plate when I put my utensils down. We will NOT be returning.
label: OG

text: Red owl killed it. We got lots of love from John and Kyle after being turned away (as hotel guests!) from the hotel sky bar. Thanks Kyle! Gave us complimentary drinks for our troubles. Really nice people and great service!
label: OG

text: Came in here to sell and was helped by two very friendly ladies at the front as soon as I walked in. They took less than half of what I brought in but priced it much higher than I expected so I wasn't disappointed. They had a great attitude and didn't make me feel bad about my "rejects". I got 50% of the sold items on store credit so I will be back soon to check out some stuff to buy. Store looks great but I didn't walk around.
label: OG

text: The rudest bar tenders in Tucson Mark is a giant stress mess every time I've been in and can't keep track of orders or paid tabs. JOJO is a real I can't even say the word on here..... After serving me an appetizer with uncooked bacon decided to pay to try something else tried to order sliders without the burger and she said " does this look like fucking Burger King?" I will never come back here worst staff of any establishment I have ever been to.....
label: OG

text: I ordered a taco pizza through the online portal. THIRTY MINUTES ELAPSED, 10 OF WHICH I WAITING IN STORE until they told me their store does not have taco pizza ingredients and that they do not know how I was able to order the pizza online. What were they doing for thirty minutes from when the order was created to when they told me they didn't have the ingredients? Why was I not notified so that I didn't drive to the store? This was a terrible experience and Pizza Hut is unprofessional and a disappointment.
label: OG

text: So, I want to start this review by saying I am not a fan of Chinese food very much.  So three stars from me is like a five star from anyone else.The food here seems fresh, and I really liked the mushroom sautee thing they had going on.  The service was nice, and they kept our teas filled and the tables clean (at a buffet, that's really all there is to it)Oh, dear God, the crab puffs.  They are SO good!  And you can just pile them onto your plate.  (Yes, that's what a buffet is, but they are so good I was so happy that I got to eat all I wanted).
label: OG

text: My bf and I just ordered takeout from Honey's. The person who took our order was extremely RUDE and SHORT with us. Granted, it was close to their closing time, but not THAT close where anyone should have had an attitude about it. If that's the case, tell us you're closed!!!!   Honey's is getting beside themselves now because of their so-called popularity. They need to remember that it was the CUSTOMERS who made it so. (Especially YELPERS.)We didn't appreciate the sarcastic and "smart-alecky" tone the cashier took with us.
label: OG

text: Whiskey Village is a staple neighborhood bar in Rittenhouse area best for once-in-a-while splurges or chill date nights.  They're known for more low-key foods (think burgers, chicken sandwiches, fries) with a classy twist.  The classy means there are high quality ingredients and the burgers are out of this world awesome, but you're not paying average prices here.  The base burger is $11 and to add cheese, it's an additional $3.5 not to mention the bacon and caramelized onions are an additional $2.5 and $1 respectively.  Between 2 burgers and a side of duck fat fries, our bill ended up close to $40 - that's no drinks included.  If you ask me that's a bit pricey to become a frequent customer, but this is one of my go-to places to take out of town guests because it's for sure an omnivorous crowd-pleaser.
label: OG

text: Mayfields is always there for me when I need to send an arrangment, whatever the occassion, it always shows up on time, is BEAUTIFUL, no matter what city it needs to show up in, and makes the recipiant so happy.  The people that take the orders are very helpful and I just can't believe I didn't find them sooner.  They are excellent with sympathy arrangements, Get Well, congratulations, Miss you, whatever.  There is always a flower or arrangement that says just what you wanted it to with Mayfields.  I'm really very pleased with their quality, customer service and product.  I've stopped in their shop on Tanque Verde, its near my home and the people are so helpful...I wish I would have found them sooner.
label: OG

text: Hickory burger! The food was good, but it gets four stars because the location adds to the experience. There's a seating area right outside with a little view of the beach, convenient to walk to from the beach, may have some trouble parking there.
label: OG

text: Outrageously overpriced for what it is. Insultingly so. It would be one thing if the cocktails warranted $12 but they simply do not. The bartender was very friendly so 2 stars for that but for that area and the subpar cocktails not even close to worth the price. Cannot speak to the food but definitely not a place I would go back to have a few drinks at.
label: OG

text: Best subs around!!! Trust me, I've done my homework!! And CHEAP!! And, open past lunch.
label: OG

text: The service is impeccable. The servers are in what I can only describe as white butler jackets and I had no less than 5 people waiting on me. Each smiling and friendly and making it seem (to me at least) that their only goal on earth was to make me happy. And then there is the food. The menu is different and unexpected (if you aren't doing the "oh, I'll just have a raw bar meal" kind of thing - not that there's anything wrong with that). If you aren't careful, you can work through your appetizer (I recommend the beet salad for flavors you can't duplicate) and your mini personal loaf of bread with whipped butter and then struggle through the large portioned, rich and overwhelming (in the best possible way) entree. You must save room for dessert (bread pudding with a sauce that could cause cardiac arrest) and then just call it a day - go home and go to bed and revel in the adventure you just experienced. Expect it to be pricy and don't expect a "normal" menu and don't be fooled that it's connected to a hotel. It loud and lively and worth the trip.
label: OG

text: I had a great experience with Pinch a Penny. They were reliable and did a great job working on our pool. I'd recommend them.
label: OG

text: Fancy shop but that's about it. Self proclaimed "wheel experts" more like experts on casting blame. #BUYERBEWARE !!! #BadService
label: OG

text: Very skimpy on cheese. I paid over 9 dollars for chili cheese fries and there was barely any cheese on them. I asked for a side of cheese and had to pay 1.50 for it. Rip off!!!!!!!!!!! They were good but I would never go there again
label: OG

text: This was the first time taking Echo or Bella here to get their nails trimmed. I will be back for sure! Tiffany was AMZING with them. I have never seen Bella take to someone outside of our family.  Keep up the great work ladies!!
label: OG

text: Have used Design Outdoor for extensive landscaping ideas and materials for our very plain, undeveloped property.  The inventory is extensive. And then great imagination in actually doing the work on site. It's been an amazing, affordable transformation.
label: OG

text: The staff was extremely friendly and knowledge able. They would give small tastes of everything to make sure you had the right thing without being annoyed. The meat and cheese was expensive though. Great location on the water but it's a little hidden.
label: OG

text: The juices here offer a great combination of taste and healthy ingredients. Recommend the Inglenook juice
label: OG

text: There is new staff here almost every time I visit, which results in multiple order errors and also payment processing issues and being over or occasionally undercharged. Since it's a drive thru setup it's pretty convenient and they have a wide variety of flavors plus mix-ins however their ice cream is just way too fake in taste and texture to ever become a favorite of mine. Not only does their ice cream not freeze it's surprisingly resistant to melting too. What kind of stabilizers are you guys using here? It tastes more like the artificial flavor used to create the "new tastes," than it actually tastes or feels like real ice cream. A pint of Ben and Jerry's or even cold stone beats this place any day of the week, though they have good malt shakes. They're open late and provide sugar. Three stars for that, not much else.
label: OG

text: 5 stars for the sushi!! We ordered 3 specialty rolls and one basic and the size of each roll combined with flavor and quality were excellent. The salmon skin was super crunchy which I love and the amount of lobster and crab on the Southern California roll was frankly staggering $13!  The service was the only draw back as our server was not overly attentive and it took a minute to place our order BUT it was a snow weekend and I think they were short handed. We'll definitely be back!!
label: OG

text: Before I give my review I want to mention that I *love* handmade goods and vintage/antique stores; in essence, OMG is right up my ally.  So I hate to give this only 3 stars after everyone else has been raving about it!  Did I miss something?  Did I go on an off-day?  I dunno, but it was a mediocre place and experience in my book, sorry to say. I think they must have been low on inventory because there wasn't much offered besides some tacky handmade jewelry and re-purposed vintage clothing that came in only size extra small.  They did have some neat antiques, but all were overpriced - I hate places that feel like they can charge you $20 for an old mason jar!  I ended up purchasing two vintage postcards and was able to haggle a bit with the owner, however.  Overall, the space was beautiful and had a cute shabby-chic feel to it, and the resident dog was super adorable.  I will certainly give this place another chance someday, and hopefully it will live up to the expectations.
label: OG

text: Enjoyed a perfect evening with good friends last night.  The food was good.  The service was excellent.  A special thank you to our waitress   Michele who helped us by pulling off a gag that she did perfectly.  The bar was great.  I didn't have to explain my drink order (Gibson) to the bartender who was friendly and attentive.  In fact the general atmosphere here was very family friendly.  Willl recommend and return for sure.
label: OG

text: Undeniably my favorite Thai spot in Nashville. Everything is good. Everything. Personal favorites: Yellow curry chicken, Cashew nut chicken stir fry, Chicken Satay, Pad Thai chicken. Even their white rice is delicious. It's just freaking white rice! Somehow, it's fantastic. Go there.
label: OG

text: Great atmosphere, good food! Had lunch here with some friends, everyone enjoyed something from the menu and we all had a good time talking and laughing! Even the owners came over and said hi! And the bartender/server was amazing! He makes the BEST mimosas Good place to hang out!
label: OG

text: Read the history of the place on the site. Great story, great service. Muffalleta, Cochon de Lait. One of Mid-city's gems!
label: OG

text: My RV radiator exploded on a road trip and Adam from big Dave's came to the rescue. We were pulled over on the side of the highway with speeding semis and when Adam got to us, he immediately started getting the rv hooked up to get us out of that danger zone. Polite efficiency is what comes to mind. And when we got to our destination he expertly drove his huge truck towing a 26' rv and did a 3 Point turn to find the obscure driveway we were looking for after dark. We just want to say thank you so much to Adam.
label: OG

text: Awful lazy service.They had a sign to seat yourself so I sat down at the bar.  I watched the only bartender face down on his pos system for 10 minutes ignoring every customer. So, I switched to the sushi bar. The sushi chef nodded at me and proceeded to clean his station for about 10 minutes. He finally asked me if I needed some help. I got up and walked out. Don't waste your time here.My group ate here the night before this happened. The service was super slow. The food itself is average. Sadly there isn't many options close by.
label: OG

text: Plain food at a good price.  This place was suggested by the concierge at our hotel.  I have to say, sometimes the people at the front desk are wrong.  We asked for a place to get good grits.  They sent us here, saying locals who work in the area eat here.That is probably true, because it is affordable and fast, and the employees are very nice.  However, food was just meh.  My "omelet" was actually scrambled eggs with some sausage in it, not much of an omelet.  I saw something go past that looked like Salisbury steak that reminded me of the food in my high school cafeteria.  Good if you're in a hurry and need an inexpensive meal, but not really representative of the level of food available in New Orleans.
label: OG

text: Famous for its frozen custard.  An icon in St. Louis.  Invented the concrete.  Never had a concrete in my life till today 9/28/2014.  I ordered a hot fudge concrete and it was huge and delicious down to the last bite.  I really don't have too much to add to the hundreds of reviews other than it deserves its reputation as an icon.
label: OG

text: I really liked this place. 1st timer. Staged well to sell, which I loved cause I hate when places don't care to make it look good. Fair and affordable prices. A nice variety of styles/items. My friend that was with me, her 1st time too, is a decorator and she really loved this place out of all the furniture shops we went to today. I'll be back.
label: OG

text: We decided to give this place a try last night and we were very disappointed. I ordered the teriyaki steak and jumbo shrimp and Dave got Shrimp Pad Thai. We also shared an order of Chinese spare Ribs.The food was pretty tasteless. The ribs were dried out and the sauce was very generic. Perhaps if we would have ordered the Chinese dishes it would have been better but I'll never know because I'll never go back.
label: OG

text: Picked up a pie for dinner a while back.  While I can't comment on the dine in or by the slice experience the shop looked clean and nice.  The pizza was strong, I loved the thin crust. I went with the charcuterie pie - I am a topping guy, and it did not disappoint. While the pizza market in NOLA seems to be getting more crowded by the day, this is a welcome addition
label: OG

text: Beautiful presentation & everything was delicious!! Can't wait to come back! Super clean, friendly service.     They are fantastic ! Don't miss out on this awesome restaurant .
label: OG

text: This place was pretty damn good.  Small plates, local, sustainable... all that fun stuff.The food was all very, very good.  Nothing absolutely blew me away, but it blows most every other place in StL away.They've got a short list of well-thought-out cocktails that are unique and delish, and a strong craft beer selection for such a restaurant.  Maybe 40 craft beers on the menu?  Impressive.When you call for reservations, it's hit or miss.  I've been laughed at by the girl who takes them - I wanted to come in that same weekend.  Don't get discouraged though, despite the fact that she's a little snot, everyone else was terrific.  My server was great, and the chef came out to check on the tables - super friendly.I'd go back, and it's worth checking out.  5-6 small plates and 5-6 drinks between two people came out to $106 before tip.  It's priced correctly.
label: OG

text: Thank you John and Kim for making Pieology a great experience.. The entire team at Hollister Village enjoyed the good eats
label: OG

text: We stopped into Scullys because we'd gotten a coupon for a free drink when we paid to park for a day of shopping at Johns Pass. Situated right  on the harbor and above the docks- we had a perfect view of the boats,water, pelicans and egrets and then a pod of dolphin! We tried four different tropical rum drinks- all Very tasty and good-sized. Late lunch was the Grouper bites( fish filet nuggets) and a spinach salad with shrimp. The Grouper bites were delicious! Thin strips of delicate fish lightly breaded and deep-fried. Not greasy and very tasty. Spinach salad was huge and contained a Lot of large, fresh steamed shrimp. The day was beautiful and sitting on the upper level patio let us experience the Florida day in all its glory!
label: OG

text: I have been coming to Grays since I have been born. It is so disappointing that this restaurant used to be 4 stars. Now it is barely a 2 star. The food quality and taste has declined over the years. The original gray brothers would be very disappointed!
label: OG

text: The food is spectacular. Probably the best breakfast I ever had. Got the Monte Cristo sandwich and orange juice. Very good meal. I would rate it 5 stars if not for the hour wait and our less than friendly wait staff. He only came to the table twice and never brought the condiments I was waiting for.
label: OG

text: Wow! I called these guys on a Sunday, not expecting them to answer. Someone picked up and answered all of my questions. I drove down there to pick up a book I needed for a class, and it was literally cheaper than anywhere else! The book cost about $25 to rent for the summer. That's sooooooooo much cheaper than the Wolfshop and anywhere else online!The next day, I decided I didn't want the book anymore; I took it in, got a full refund, no questions asked!These guys are great! I will definitely do all of my Fall textbook shopping here, and I will definitely encourage all of my friends to do the same!
label: OG

text: 1st time at this location, but service is, as always, a 12 on a 1-10 score. If a Harvard MBA was to write a book on simplicity done well, this would seriously be the model.  Kudos.
label: OG

text: Not impressed, as someone who has food allergies, their disclaimer "don't bother eating, please only drink" on the menu, was perceived to me as rude.  I eat out a lot, have a nut allergy and have never had problem with restaurants being more than willing to accommodate.  I was excited to try the fish tacos...but I guess that won't be happening.
label: OG

text: I stopped in here recently with some friends after a Yelp Elite Event.The vibe in this place is awesome. It has a great dive bar feel and isn't too fussy and not too "hipstery." The layout ensures plenty of bar seating. The bartender we had was efficient and friendly, and there was a great rotating beer selection.The one thing that really stands out is the food. The lamb grilled cheese in particular was life-changing. I will return just because of that. The prices were a little bit on the higher end, but that's to be expected for the high quality of food and beverages served here.
label: OG

text: Love the enviro, badass vibe in there. We went on Thursday, which, is 'taco night'. The  vast selection of choices meats and non-meats (non!) were appreciated. I wanted to order off the 'normal' menu, but was told, only the 'taco' menu was in use this night. I do think its cool of them to do this, but there were a few things I REALLY wanted to try off the 'normal' menu. We ordered some chips 'n salsa, and some guac. Guac was great, salsa was good, more of a pico, however, and this seemed to be a bit of a theme, the place needs to use bigger ramekins. We had to order 2 refills of salsa due to the TINY vessel we were given. Lame. Secondly, please, for the love of god, MAKE YOUR OWN CHIPS!. I was almost sure, they were using $2 "Santinas" chips. This, is not acceptable. My sisters veg burrito was grilled, and good, my fish tacos, were indeed bland right off the bat, however with the 2 potato taquitos I ordered (average), there was some great chimichurri, which, of course, I had to ask for more of, twice, and I used it to spice up my tacos The only issue I see going forward, was 'weak' AC, this coming summer, this MAY be a real issue. There was fans, but, really, who wants fans. We'll go back, but, it better be chilly in there!
label: OG

text: These folks are so nice. I get my shirts done here and they do a great job and are always ready. They are very friendly too. Good old fashioned friendly customer service from a very nice family. Oh, and they give my dog treats each time I bring him by.  What's not to love?
label: OG

text: Very cool neighborhood bar. Just stopped in for drinks, the bartender was very friendly and I had a great Moscow mule. Smoking is allowed inside, which I think is the only drawback.
label: OG

text: Don't Underestimate the Lobster and Shrimp RavioliIt's another surprising dish from the Olive Garden's specials. I asked before I ordered what the waitress's evaluation of this dish was, knowing from the past I get a true evaluation. She stated: "We sell out of this at times." My reply: "let me have it."Well she wasn't wrong at all. It was delicious and my evaluation comes from a person who is an Italian cook. The staff here is always very nice. I sat at the bar because I was eating solo and it's more convenient. Don't miss this dish as it will not always be available.
label: OG

text: The Bun Bo (spicy beef noodle soup) did not disappoint and the tofu in the tofu spring rolls was fried to perfection.  There was only one guy in there working both the kitchen and the restaurant.  The service was slow, but very friendly.   Pretty greasy though.
label: OG

text: I went to P&P on a Saturday about 20 minutes after it opened because I read reviews about long wait times. The wait actually wasn't horrible, only about 15 minutes.  The decor is fresh and rustic. The service was great and the food was excellent! I ordered the duck confit hash which I highly recommend. The portions are large and pretty filling. PP ordered the french toast and fried chicken was freaking delicious! I know because I ate his leftovers the next day lol. I'll definitely be back!
label: OG

text: As others have said, for the money you can't beat this place. My gf and I stayed in a king patio room for 2 nights, and we will definitely be back. The proximity to the harbor, wharf, and downtown is ideal. Dan at the front desk was very helpful w/suggestions and even gave me some stamps to mail some bills I forgot before I left. Thanks! The grounds are very clean, and there's a park across the street. I read a few reviews about homeless in the park, while we did see a few, they were a distance away, and we saw many more homeless on the beach and even downtown.     I don't need a super fancy room, but a comfy King size bed is a must for us, and Castillo Inn delivered. Super comfy mattress with premium feeling bedding. The towels were even super nice and plush. They provide a basic continental breakfast you're typical fare, but they also have a bunch of different juices and teas for you to take with and GREAT coffee. That was a nice surprise.     You do pick up a little bit of noise being near a busy street but It wasn't a big deal to us. Immaculate, tastefully decorated rooms, great location, and service?! Thanks Castillo Inn we'll be back.
label: OG

text: How could you give this event anything but 5 stars? This was such a great event and I was glad I had the opportunity to go with my brother. What is there not to like about hundreds of great tasting beers, a silent disco, beer pong and swag (especially from the yelp table)? There were so many beers that I had never really heard of before and some were really really good! All the brewers seemed very passionate about their craft which was great to see.This is going to be an annual event for me for sure!
label: OG

text: This place is ok. I don't recommend the chicken marsala. It tasted like a piece of chicken with Campbell's cream of chicken soup on it. There are some nice appetizers. It's nothing special.
label: OG

text: Cheu is a restaurant with a really cool vibe to it. The space isn't that large, so it's probably not ideal for large groups.From 5:30-6:30 they do a happy hour, and the cheaper drinks and appetizers are definitely a good deal. We split wings from the happy hour menu and they were a good choice--super flavorful.I got the brisket ramen, which was really good. The broth was rich, there was a lot of meat, and the kimchi added some spice. The matzah ball had a great melt-in-your-mouth texture. I thought it was overall a tiny bit too salty, especially the matzah ball, but it was definitely yummy.Overall I really liked the feel of the restaurant and the food was great. I would definitely go again!
label: OG

text: I was SO nervous about going to get a Brazilian for the first time. I was literally shaking when I walked in the door. The girls at the front desk (I didn't get their names) were SO sweet and reassured me that I would be absolutely fine. Kayleah was awesome, explained the process as she was going, kept talking to me, and made me laugh the whole time. The whole place was spotless, and while I wouldn't use the word "painless", it was far from being as painful as I thought it would be. Such a great experience. I will absolutely be returning!
label: OG

text: Do not book them!!! Buyer beware!! WORST EXPERIENCE EVER. I booked 3 guys and a 26 foot truck and they showed up with 2 guys and the truck already had someone else's stuff in it. The guys they sent could barely lift any furniture so it took ages and my husband had to help with anything heavy. They didn't wrap anything and took no care loading  so all my furniture was scuffed. They took massive gouges out of my wall and complained "you guys have too much stuff" even though they didn't need to mattresses, box springs or chairs, just a living room set and boxes.They charged me extra time, and we ended up just unloading everything in front of the house and I had to call friends to help bring everything in. I was afraid my items would be held hostage if I didn't give them more money.They took numerous breaks, were rude and unprofessional and tracked mud into my brand new house.I'll be filing a complaint with the Better Business Bureau as well.
label: OG

text: This spinning studio is amazing! I have attended their spin classes regularly since January and still love every class that i go to!As mentioned in other reviews of the studio, the facility is amazing... Kept immaculately clean and with a great ambiance, you can't help but fall in love with the vibe of the studio. On top of the amazing location, wonderful decoration, and the best spin bikes ever (they have magnetic traction with an awesome screen that helps you track your RPM as well as resistance) the instructors at this studio are wonderful.I have taken other spin classes and never fallen in love with the workout until I started at body cycle. The instructors (especially the awesome owner, Russel Carter) take time to learn the names of the students and really provide a personal experience that pushes you to your limit at every workout.I have brought many of my friends with me to the studio because I honestly cannot rave about it enough... My family even visited from out of town last week and I included one of Russel's spin classes as part of their Philly tour!Love this place!!!
label: OG

text: As a huge hot dog fan, I must admit I was a little skeptical of trying a veggie dog from this place but I am so glad that I did. Best hot dog I have had all summer. The staff here is super friendly and the menu is awesome. They can also make any of their specialty dogs with veggie dogs. The roll was awesome too. My boyfriend tried the Saigon Fusion and loved it. The menu is a little pricey, but worth it.
label: OG

text: Some of the best Chinese I have had! Its our new go to place. The sushi is also very good!
label: OG

text: So my sister drove me all the way down to the Wildflower Cafe when we were running late for things, and had tons to do. It HAD to be good to make this time sacrifice in the day.My mom is in the back seat chirpinig "I know where it is, I know!" But leading us in the wrong direction.....2 U-turns later we arrive! (PS- it is across the street from the entrance to the Biltmore.)This is an adorable, whimsical little cafe. There is plenty of table seating, but the inside is pretty small and a little crammed.They have a great, eclectic menu of soups, salads, sandwiches and quiche-type things. Perfect for a lunch with the girls! My sister and I both got the chicken salad sandwich.....delicious! No canned chicken here, everything is fresh and homemade. My mom ordered the pecan chicken torte.....yeah.....I know.....and yes, it was every bit as delciious as it sounds!We ended the meal with a salty oatmeal cookie, that I would inject into my blood stream if I could.....that means it was really good!In summary, if you are in the area, this should quickly become your go-to lunch place. If you are not, you will not be disappointed after a drive, totally worth it!
label: OG

text: Don't waste your money or time!!!!! I was visiting philly from NY with my mother and wanted to have a nice steak dinner after wine tasting across the street. A guy in the wine ship told us the steaks at Marmont were good so we decided to try it boyyyyyy was that the wrong decision. Once we arrived we were immediately sat by the host who was very polite. Upon sitting the atmosphere was busy and a bit noisy as there was a large party celebrating an occasion over dinner. We placed our orders for the bacon wrapped filet mignon and the pepper crusted NY Strip Steak along with some sides. Our drinks came promptly, the food took about 40 minutes. That was a little long but expected since we ordered steaks. While we waited for our food to arrive things took a turn for the ABSOLUTE WORSE when the waiters decided to kick the large party off of their table and allow them to squeeze into their cramped bar located an arms length away from dining customers to continue the party. It suddenly turned into a frat party with intoxicated people who were still being served drinks screaming over each other and crowding around tables of people trying to enjoy their meal. I watched as a couple managed to get their meals down in 15 mins and promptly leave. Either way by the time we received our food I was ready to leave as none of the staff addressed this issue. They simply pushed through the crowd and continued working as if this was not a restaurant. The steaks were okay, just OK. They were a little over cooked and my ny strip steak was a bit salty maybe it was the crust of pepper seasoning. I wouldn't order it again...The filet was fine aside from it not being medium as requested. Once we received our food, I ignored the shortcomings of the dishes and kindly explained to our waiter that the bar shenanigans were unacceptable in a restaurant full of people spending a pretty penny on dinner. Instead of her immediately correcting the issue as I shouldn't have to state the obvious. She went on to tell me they were a large party celebrating as if that made it okay. After 20 minutes, more than halfway through my steak she comes back over to say the bar tender mentioned something to them although the frat party was still in full swing and she continued to serve them alcohol. At that point, another couple was ready to leave before ordering their main courses because of the noise and lack of management. We ended up hurrying out of there praying for the couple we left sitting next to us. If you like eating dinner in a frat house, go for it! I would never eat here again or recommend this place to anyone !!!!! Absolutely horrible. This restaurant needs a crash course on running a fine dining establishment based on the cost of dinner. If I went to Buffalo Wild Wings, I wouldn't even expect the nonsense that was happening that night. Advice to management: this is not a sports bar so treat your guests accordingly.
label: OG

text: Please bring back the potato skins!!! Trips is great, good service, food, and prices. I'd give 5 stars if the potato skins were back on the menu!
label: OG

text: This is the best gelato in Tucson.  They rotate their flavors, my favorites, are the salted caramel, the dark chocolate, and the black cherry marble.  It's creamy and smoother, and airier than other Tucson gelatos.  You can taste as much as you want to find the right flavor.  I like how friendly they are - they bring you water outside as you're eating you're gelato, and they say "Chao" when you leave!  It's also very clean, and they have misters outside!
label: OG

text: Always a great time sampling a huge selection of beers.  The weather always seems to be hot so make sure to hydrate.  Also make a pretzel necklace to bring with you.  Pretzels and beer are the best!
label: OG

text: I go here maybe 2 times a week for lunch.  It's always charcoal fored chicken with differant sides everyday  for just $7.00. It's always delicious and a great value.  Try it once and you will be hooked like i am. The line gets long , so get thier before noon or after 1;30 if your in a rush.
label: OG

text: My friend took her car to this place after buying a deal from a solicitor. It's a total SCAM!!! Do not go here!! They are terrible. And not only do they do bad bad bad work, but they don't even care. When she reported to Mario himself, he shrugged of the lack of vaccuming. When she called to also follow up and find out what product they had used on her care so she could get it removed, he yelled at her and then hung up on her. Terrible service and terrible work matched with terrible attitude. Do not be fooled......never take anything you own here. I would rate negative stars if I could.
label: OG

text: Ah that crack fox. when venturing down town it's nice to know there is still a place where you can never quite be sure what is going on next.. is it punk rock karaoke with al swaker, is it a rock a billy band, or maybe a super cool burlesque show, or an awesome goth night.... The venue is a throw back to what the Galaxy once was and the red and black walls provide comforting familiarty. the beer selection is pretty big for a small downtown bar, the cocktails well poured. The crowd in general friendly and the staff is pretty great. If you go I recommend trying the Greasers Lunch box..
label: OG

text: The highs - prompt service, food delivered fast and hot.  GREAT pancakes and large portions.  Solid blue-plate breakfast.The lows - the coffee.  Drip generic blah.  Nothing fancy - the bacon was limp, thin and generic.  Food was probably Sysco, straight out of the truck (except for the pancakes).  However, for the portions, the price was right and nothing was below-par by any stretch of the imagination (except for the coffee).  Recommended - go for the pancakes, the bloody marys and bring your cafe-au-lait with you.
label: OG

text: The best breakfast ever!!! And the best service our waitress Kim was wonderful.:. Try this place you won't be disappointed
label: OG

text: Solid beer, many variations of seasonal beers and staples are great. I eat here once a week and have tried most of the food. A brew pub can't have bad food and Iron Hill never disappoints !
label: OG

text: If you need anything to help you be your beautiful self, definitely check out this Sephora.  I have always been greeted by super friendly folks who have tons of info.  After much research for a new face moisturizer, I decided to take my new knowledge out to Sephora to see what they had to recommend.
