They pointed me in the direction of the product I was already considering, so I can say they know their stuff.If you like to play before purchasing, this is definitely the place for you. Their prices are a bit more than if you were to go to a drug store, but this is usually better quality stuff.  I will admit that on occasion, I get home and don't love the products. Not because they are bad, but because I just didn't need it.
label: OG

text: I had a pretty terrible facial, and filled out the survey (they email one out automatically after every service) explaining this and asked to be contacted by management. I was not. Then, I tried to schedule a massage using their online scheduling and was never contacted to either confirm my time or say that they were booked. So, I submitted another form explaining that I was disappointed in their service and was told I would be contacted within 2 days. A week later, Mary emailed me apologizing and offering to give me a complimentary add-on (i.e. hot stones, etc.) to my next massage. Trying to schedule an appointment with her was like pulling teeth. I gave her a few dates / times that worked for me and got a reply saying I was booked for a different day / time. I emailed her back explaining that was not the day I requested. I am now getting phone calls to confirm my appointment (that was wrongly made and should have been deleted). It should not be this difficult to book an appointment, especially for someone who already has an issue with the service. Save yourself the frustration and go to Ardmore Massage Envy - they're great and it's so easy to schedule an appointment. Avoid Plymouth Meeting at all costs.
label: OG

text: I haven't been here in 2016.  We went constantly when they first opened.  I don't know how many free burger coupons I earned, but it was a lot.  I slowly watched the quality degrade.  One of my co-workers still loves the place, but I just don't have the desire to go.  The last time I went, my burger was soaking wet from oil.  I love a good greasy burger, but my bun was soggy and lost all of it's flavor.  My co-worker likes to go there on his birthday, so I booked a trip to the midwest, just to avoid going here with him.  Such a shame, because it used to be so good.
label: OG

text: Ralph oh ralph,Im not sure about you. I was impressed with your creative cocktails at the bar, but was dissapointed with the food.The menu is small and the items arent very interesting.  For an upscale restaurant, I was hoping for delicous food, and it was just OK...with my fish being less than good.  I hate to give you 2 stars based on one visit, especially since service was good, but I just wasnt impressed. If I lived in the area I would go for drinks not for dinner.
label: OG

text: Lüke will only receive a three star this time. Although the restaurant look very nice the service was just okay. The hostess was not very friendly. The bartenders were not very friendly when ordering a glass of wine for my girlfriend. Our waiter was actually pretty nice, he did say sorry a lot. Now about the food. For appetizer we ordered was the rabbit- liver pâté which was actually very good. The steak was okay. Nothing to write home about. The crab bisque was fantastic.   There now you know.
label: OG

text: Absolutely phenomenal food. Fresh, flavorful and filling. Very quick service and quick to bring the food out. Staff is super friendly. Yes the lines are out the door but they move quickly. I had the Benton Park and it was perfect. My friend had a hot dog dressed with so many toppings and loved it. Live band was playing inside but people were bringing their own chairs out to the street corners to listen and enjoy their sandwiches and beer. We ran into a number of friends while here. Ate on the curb outside because there were no chairs available but it was fun! What a St. Louis gem this place is!
label: OG

text: I've only eaten here once so far, so this review is subject to future revision.  I had been reading all of the reviews about pho on this site and had developed the overwhelming desire to try it and try it now!  So this weekend I visited Sizzling Wok.  It was very nice inside.  I ordered the rare beef pho, and was shocked at the size of the bowl.  I ended up taking about a third of it home.  (And I was thrilled to discover that the flavors had developed even more when I heated it the next day!)I really didn't look at the menu apart from the pho, but it seemed pretty big.  A lot of the pages had typical Chinese dishes and as others have mentioned, that could be handy if your companions aren't adventurous with food.  (The mere concept is unthinkable to me!)  The hostess/waitress seemed to be on her own at the time, but there weren't too many tables with customers so that was no problem.  She seemed friendly enough.  The place looked very clean, which is always a plus.  I'd never had any pho to compare this to, but I was very happy with the dish.  It was quite flavorful.I'll definitely be hitting some of the other pho restaurants around the city to compare.  Now that I've tried it, I'm hooked!
label: OG

text: Standard chain buffet.  The salad in the salad bar did seem fresh and the "new" wings were pretty good, if a little cold.
label: OG

text: Great food tasty, clean and courteous staff. Try the Bosnian Bread with spiced lamb very good and tasty. Going back for the pastries and coffee.
label: OG

text: I placed an order on GrubHub, which I do regularly, and I listed an alternate phone number under "special instructions". They obviously didn't read the instructions because I had to call an hour after I placed the order to ask what was going on and they said the delivery guy knocked for '15 minutes'. Knocking on an apartment building door isn't going to get anyone's attention, especially when a phone number is listed. I'll order from somewhere else for my late night munchies.
label: OG

text: If you only do one thing, do it well. Bab Cafe does some kickass bibimbap. I lived in South Korea, where the rice bowl is a staple, and this stuff was good. Veggies and add-one were tasty, you can sub brown rice, everything comes with miso soup and the portions are big. The homemade hot pepper paste is really good! Try the japchae for something different - they're delicious noodles with little bits of meat and veg. Kind of hard to find in the States but so worth it. Hit it up.
label: OG

text: All I need is a good waiter to tell me what I want and I feel I get the experience the chef was trying to express.  I got my waiter and I got my experience.... perfect.  Luke is now on my list for life.  I will be back with the wife.
label: OG

text: Having heard about Ted Drewes Frozen Custard from absolutely everyone I asked before my trip to St. Louis, I knew this was something I'd have to check out while here for a conference.  My co-worker and I walked from our Italian restaurant on The Hill to Ted Drewes, which was a lot farther than we expected.  It was a lovely evening though, and having lived on the West Coast my entire life, I'd never seen neighborhoods such as we were strolling through.Having finally made it to the mythic Custard Stand, we were glad that the busser at dinner warned us not to be intimidated by the throng of people in front.  The lines moved extremely quickly, the girls taking orders didn't seem rushed and were happy to explain what the myriad choices and flavors all were.  We settled on concretes - custard, toppings and flavors all blended together.  I had a "Black Jack Rabbit" (chocolate covered tart cherries - which I believe were high quality maraschino cherries) and my colleague chose Mint and M&Ms.  Our concretes were ready within a few moments, and we retired across the street to the benches in front of the bank, to rest our weary feet on the cool grass.  The custard was tasty, but honestly I don't see what all the fuss is all about.  It's different than what's on offer at the local Dairy Queen, but not drastically so.  It's the experience that really puts this institution onto the list of special places.  The friendly staff and great whopping piles of locals and kids enjoying sundaes and concretes for the umpteenth time really takes you back to (what I assume was) a simpler time.Watching the fireflies come out while my friend and I finished our custards (well, as much of the HUGE medium size as we could) was enchanting.  Ted Drewes may not be the best thing in the world, but it's pretty darned good, and a fabulous experience while you're visiting St. Louis.
label: OG

text: This place is just adorable! The inside decor is very trendy and cool and the outside has twinkly lights hung up and is great for people watching! I got the "ben's bread" and it was really yummy and had all sorts of bread with different cheeses and toppings, great appetizer! I also got the Nutella iced late and I really enjoyed it because it wasn't overpowering but you definitely taste the Nutella. Most of all, the service is GREAT! Our waitress Sierra was very friendly and helpful and the entire team really made sure that I had a nice visit. I suggest this place to anyone looking for a snack or coffee in Nashville.
label: OG

text: While Body Cycle may not have the pizazz of FlyWheel, I'm a traditionalist and prefer the style here. The staff and instructor made me feel welcome and showed me the proper way to setup my bike to fit my body. The studio was clean and bright and I will definitely be back! Shoutout to Ross for a great class; I burned over 550 calories!
label: OG

text: Took my car here to use a Groupon for an oil change, they did not even change my oil filter and my was low on oil only 1,000 miles after having the oil change, so who knows if they even changed the oil  Would not recommend using Midas, I will never take my car to one again.
label: OG

text: Stopped in here on the way to Limerick to pick up my car.My husband likes trying new places and I accommodate him.As another reviewer wrote................the music will burst your eardrums.  So we opted to sit outside even though the ambiance didn't look appetizing as Route 422 is right in the backyard.  I have to tell you it was so much better outside.We split the Shrimp & Crab dip....it comes with several pieces of toasted garlic bread and it was indeed okay.The pizza on the other hand was really nothing to write home about.  The crust was tasteless and we should have just eaten the top with a fork.Our server was young and probably not too experienced though she was very pleasant and tried hard.Just don't think we'll have a second meal here.
label: OG

text: LOVE this place! Great food, very reasonable prices, very friendly staff, great service.Note that I tried the delivery service and they were great.One of my favorite places!!
label: OG

text: Decent breakfast, not the cleanest place I've ever been. Nothing to write home about.
label: OG

text: We did the New Orleans ghost tour. The biggest waste of money, time and energy I think I've ever had. We had the WORST tour guide, she almost acted like she was on some sort of drugs and couldn't keep her rambling coherent at all. We were in a good of 28, and probably 12-15 had dropped from the group within the first 30 mins. She even took us to a closed restroom facility at our break. Don't waste your time or money.
label: OG

text: PEOPLE: CHECK YOUR BILL!!!! I guess mistakes can happen. But coincidentally it happened twice.  We were overcharged by $20.00. It my first visit to R2L.  But my son and his girlfriend had been there before.  And surprise, surprise, not only were they charged $40 for champagne that they did not order, but the employee actually insinuated that perhaps they just forgot that they ordered/drank champagne. To make matters worse, I had a gift card worth $75.00.  The waitress told me my card was declined.  Was I sure I hadn't used it before.  No I said, this is my first time here.  (It will be my last). The waitress informs me they have been having problems with the gift cards.  The manager gets involved.  Can I give him the name of the person who gave me the card.  Yes I can.  Do I have a receipt? No, it was a gift from my future son-in-law and he is currently deployed to Qatar.  Manager tells me not to worry, I comped you the $75.00.  WTF.  You comped me??? That's funny since the gift giver paid his hard earned money for said card. No, I will not return. Upscale??? I think not. Overpriced Scammers is more like it.
label: OG

text: They have the best bagels! I recommend the egg sandwiches or lox on a bagel. Soo fresh and delicious. Friendly and quick service every visit.
label: OG

text: Red velvet cake was dry. Disappointed. Icing and filling were great but cake was too dry.
label: OG

text: Words cannot describe the experience at Federal Donuts, but I'll try.   A tiny little shack in south Philly with some of the best fried chicken I've ever had.  The chili garlic flavour is the signature, and it doesn't disappoint.  Each order is served with a freshly fried lemon honey donut, which was our favourite flavour.  I loved it so much I bought one of their tee shirts to make all my friends jealous!  Get there early, though.  They run out daily.
label: OG

text: The steak was tough and chewy. The steak sauce was watered down. A1 flavored water is what it looked like. First thing in the morning and the condiment bottles were greasy and caked with the previous day's gunk. The owner was the only one who seemed to smile. The biscuits and gravy and crunchy bacon was the only saving grace of the meal.With the overall experience big thumbs down.
label: OG

text: I stopped in here for a couple of beers and a snack after seeing a performance on Broad Street. I wanted to stop in a bar around the corner but it was full as per usual and so I decided to try this place. The bar had an alright selection of beers on tap and the prices weren't bad. I got an order of garlic fries too. The order was huuuuge. In truth the fries are more like thick cut chips but they were still pretty darn good and very garlicky. It came with a tasty dipping sauce too. I'd probably stop in for a drink another time, despite the fact that the night I was there the bar was overrun by rather obnoxious 20 something girls in large groups all talking loudly and being obnoxious in ways that only white girls of a certain tax bracket can be. But, needless to say, the place wasn't totally overrun with twits.
label: OG

text: This would not be my typical hang out on a weekend BUT I went early for dinner and it was very good. I had the risotto and tasted the pork osso bucco..think that's what it's called..and they were both great. I suggest to go early and avoid the "Usual Crowd".
label: OG

text: I LOVE New Day! Being a lover of local and craft libations, but not huge on beer, New Day is just what I need. I can't say I love every mead and cider there is, but there are a couple that I can't get enough of.2 great things: $5 flights - 6 small tastings of your choice.$6 growler fills on Tuesday. That is quite the deal, but you have to have a New Day growler, so make sure you grab one while you're there.
label: OG

text: The Peppermill is our go-to Reno hotel!  Whether the hubby and I want to relax in a jacuzzi tub with room service breakfast (a great deal BTW), or if the goal is to have some drinks, gamble and goof around, this is the place. I have stayed in the original Spa suite (corny, slightly porono-ish, but fun ;) ((you want this room if you get a great deal on it...kind of older decor)., the Standard tower room (nice, very comfortable beds, roomy room) and three separate Tuscany Tower rooms (two queen and the Florence suite twice).  (I recommend the Tuscany Tower to anyone, especially if you can get a great deal on it).My favorite is the Tuscany Tower rooms, The Florence villa being an extra treat, but not necessary.  These rooms are exquisite!! Incredibly comfy beds, several flat screen TV's, marbled bathrooms with large jacuzzi tub and very nice decor. Oceana has good sushi, yummy pan roast and the lobster mashed potatoes at Bimini are my fave.  (this is not 5 star because I am not blown away by the food).The 6.99 cafe breakfasts after midnight are fun and yummy, room service for breakfast (omelette) is a great deal, and pass up the pastries at the coffee shop.
label: OG

text: Nestled at the often-too-overlooked northeast end of Mass Ave downtown you'll find one of the city's most charming locally-owned bookstores with a mission: literacy. Indy Reads Books is known for going beyond being a book peddler to offering community and literacy-based programming with cool partnership. Another reason for loving IRB is that they're pretty damn stylish. I have yet to do it, but I would like to add this space to my rotation of businesses that make for good popup office hours.  The store sells used, new, Hoosier authors and often compiles collections based on themes like Irish literature and authors for St.Patrick's Day. I equally recommend a visit for bibliophiles and Indy lovers alike.
label: OG

text: Really great place if you are looking for something private and quiet for a romantic get away! We stayed in one of the queen cottages with awesome whirlpool tub and also a fireplace. It had A/C, fireplace, amazing whirlpool tub,cute little patio, nice soft bed and super soft sheets. It was small, but we didn't spend a lot of time in the room except for the evening. We had an issue with the safe and also the jets on the tub, but the front desk took care of it really quickly. My only complaint was that the staff was not incredibly friendly. I like the fact that we were allowed to be independent, but our reception was really lacking. Eehh, I like that warm feeling when I go somewhere new. All in all, we would absolutely return. My boyfriend became my fiance at this place, so I think it will always bring back wonderful memories! I look forward to returning for many years so that we can remember our special weekend in Santa Barbara!
label: OG

text: This place has an excellent selection of costumes of ALL kinds all year round.  The stock is unreal, the masks and accessories are awesome.  It's a great place to go to first and then shop around and come back to if you're unsure, but the selection is truly ideal for any holiday or season.During the Halloween time or parade season, they get all kinds of new and improved fun stuff!  Make this a must-visit especially during these times from makeup to hats, to shoes and masks, to the main costume itself and wild accessories!
label: OG

text: We had a very special experience at Cafe Ponte. All four of us loved our choices. Some notable items include the oyster app & calamari app, cauliflower side, scallop entree, as well as the evening's special, chorizo stuffed quail wrapped in bacon. And, oh my, those donuts!  Chef de Cuisine Jason Lutzk knows what he's doing and does it well!
label: OG

text: Love the space, drinks and food, but service is not so good. Owner needs to make sure the bartenders 'get it'. Too much chatting amongst the bartenders and not enough attention to the customers. We'll be back but maybe try the upstairs bar next time.
label: OG

text: Dollar Rent a Car Ulmerton Rd . . . . . Worst rental car experience.  2 men/one 7 passenger van.  The driver and helper also worked the desk with registrations etc. and ran back and forth to the airport between their desk duties (unbeknownst to us until later).   If they are busy, they leave you waiting, and waiting and waiting!  It took me and my friend over 2  hours to get from the airport to the rental car!  They do not answer their phone when you are waiting so you have to just assume you haven't been forgotten! There's a recording indicating they are between  trips. There is no phone receptionist.Don't look for them outside the airport baggage door.  They pick up about 30 feet away in the parking lot.  If you don't know this, you might miss them.  Their signage on the van is small.  And if it's pouring down rain, makes no difference.   If there are more than 7 customers waiting,  too bad.  You wait for them to do a turn around . . . and they only return after they have done the paper work and dispensed cars to the lucky 7 who got on before you. Lastly,  if you expect to get your car and be on your merry way after the paperwork; cross your fingers.  I heard them tell the customer in front of me that there was no gas in her car, go down the road and fill up and to be sure to bring it back empty!  All in all, the Dodge Dart was a good performer and I had no problems with the return.  I made sure I was at the rental car desk at 7:45 for my 9:30 a.m.  flight and I made sure I returned it with the appropriate amount of gas . . . otherwise they charge  you $9+ per gallon.
label: OG

text: I'm somewhere between 3 and 4 stars. The ambiance is great, you do not feel like you are in a strip mall at all. As the other reviews said the service needs improvement. We were there on a weekend evening and they seemed to have a hard time keeping up with typical service wait times. It took a while to receive water and menus once seated. We received our miso and salads fairly quick, but the seaweed salad wasa either missed with the kitchen or behind. The food was all very tasty. According to the husband the seaweed salad was fantastic. There were 2 different prices for the rolls with no explanation of the difference and no differentiation on the order slip (you complete your own for the rolls). The rolls we received were all 8 pieces but they were small, not much in them. They had large gaps between bringing each roll out to us. Midway through our service they seemed to realize the slow service on the floor and I assume the manage came out to assist. If they can improve their service and either make the rolls a bit more robust or explain the menu better we will likely become regulars. I'm hoping they do.
label: OG

text: Stayed here on my way back from Burning Man. I showed up looking like hell. In fact, after I checked in and looked at myself in the mirror I was surprised that she didn't call security or the fashion police on me. But no, the front desk clerk treated me like I was a normal human being.The room looked like the presidential suite after living in the desert for 2 weeks - it was clean and comfortable and I could park my car right in front of the room. I had no complaints at all and had a great experience. Came highly recommended by locals as being particularly safe as well.
label: OG

text: I had never step foot in a Bloomingdale's before, so I wasn't sure what to expect. High prices? Looks I could never pull off? Nope and nope!This Bloomingdale's outlet has a nice selection of apparel at great prices -- some even dirt cheap. I found an adorable lace dress with capped sleeves for only $30. Incredible.They also stock a bunch of shoes (separated by size, which I always appreciate), shirts, pants, etc. While I only purchased the dress on my first visit, I'll definitely be returning soon to give my spring/summer wardrobe a little boost.Note: Its upstairs in the Shops at Liberty Place.
label: OG

text: Great hotel. Lovely grounds. Stayed here a few times. It is not super fancy, but it is nice. There is a coffee shop restaurant right on the grounds. Plenty of parking, great rates, nice pool. I had a ground floor room with sliding doors out to the pool. I had to change my reservations a few times and they were very accommodating. I like to stay here when visit my friends as they live right across the street. There is a shopping center and a mall across the street as well. Easy on and off from the freeway.
label: OG

text: I came here tonight for th first time to a Benihana. I have been to hibachis before and I have had a very pleasant experience but tonight was ridiculous. I am a religious vegetarian and I had conveyed that to the waiter (Ayed I think his name was) about 3-4 times before beginning. He not only ignored my comments but was completely disrespectful of it by mixing the chicken with the tofu and not bothering to use different utensils. I have been to hibachis before where when I told them I was a religious vegetarian made special arrangements and cooked the meat beforehand or even told me straight up that they couldn't make arrangements for me, both which I respected. This guy was just disrespectful and the food tasted over cooked, hard and tasteless. I could not eat most the meal because I was disgusted at the way it was cooked. I didn't even bother taking a box home since about 80% of my meal was untouched. I was not the only one who felt this way and my co customers also agreed. Since this was my first experience at Benihana I cannot make a statement but I would not recommend this place and especially this chef if u decide that go there.
label: OG

text: So I am a fairly new business traveler. I work pretty hard, long days and have expectations of eating super special meals since I am missing out on my family time, I may as well be happy in the tummy. I take my YELP family with me wherever I go so that I can get some assistance searching out those special spots away from home. Which brings me to Trattoria Marcella. Everyone in St Louis said if I want Italian, I have to go to the Hill. Wasn't sure what the Hill was but now I know, it's like the little Italy of St Louis. There are so many Italian restaurants here, if you didn't have YELP, you might not know how to choose the right one. The boss and I don't get out for dinner until 8:30 and literally some places will reject you this late in St Louis on the weekdays; but not Marcella!The menu is vast, hard to choose from all the dishes offered. The boss gets lasagna; very safe choice in my opinion. But really, it was the best lasagna either of us had ever had and the serving is huge. I don't know why or how the ricotta was so pillow soft and delicious; it just was! He only ate half and I had expectations that he would bring it into the office the next day for lunch - NO, he ate the rest when he got home (he resides in St Louis), said it was dessert - that's how good it was!!!I ordered the agnolotti del plin which is ravioli filled with meat, rice and spinach topped with truffle butter, fresh spinach, parmigiana reggiano. Amazing, rich and delicious. We also split a salad and it too was terrific. Their wine list is fabulous, I order us a pinot  nior and we both loved it.The second visit, the boss ordered lasagna again and i ordered the salmon with spinach; another excellent meal.This place is so quaint. Both times we had awesome conversations with the waiter, waitress and the manager. It's so down home wonderful. This place would be romantic if you were with your special someone, rather than your boss!
label: OG

text: We stayed here from a Saturday through a Wednesday. The biggest pro was that it was very, very clean! The front desk staff was also friendly and sometimes they would leave surprises out for guests at night like cookies or hot dogs! Onto the cons. We had a problem with the toilet in our room frequently clogging, but the hotel staff always fixed it within a matter of minutes. The only "weird" item was that a new scratch-off ticket was taken from our room. It only cost $2, so it wasn't a huge deal, but I still included it as a comment to hotel management in the survey they sent me afterwards because I wanted them to be aware of the issue.However, I was pleasantly surprised when the manager wrote me back and offered some choice hotel points for my troubles with the toilet and the lottery scratch-off.Overall, I would definitely stay here again in the future.
label: OG

text: Morton's Steakhouse simply isn't worth it.  Everything about my dinner there was lackluster.  But the most important question is, how was the steak?  My 8oz filet was overcooked (medium instead of medium-rare), burnt/blackened on top, and lacking in flavor.  My date's slightly smaller filet was properly cooked (medium rare), but was similarly lacking in flavor.  The chocolate cake dessert was okay, but I've had better at local diners.  To make matters worse, our server did not introduce himself and was not pleasant towards us.  There are so many wonderful steakhouses in Philly.  Morton's just doesn't happen to be one of them.
label: OG

text: I got the honey bar today for the second time and it was great. However I found a piece of plastic wrap in my food which turned me off. Sometimes the service is a little rough and now I wonder if their prep is lacking as well...
label: OG

text: The food is always good here but the employees are very very slow. There's always a massive line,  of because of an influx of people but because of sluggish service
label: OG

text: Went again, and the Pork Belly White Bean Chili blew my mind.  And the beer list yet again contributed to the explosion.SO LOUD ON FRIDAY NIGHT THOUGH.
label: OG

text: Love this restaurant. The flavors are so wonderful in everything I've ordered. The only thing is the wait time and the crowds during the busy nights. But sitting outside with a glass of wine is not so bad. Highly recommended restaurant!
label: OG

text: Great home style food. Decent Salad Bar and very friendly staff. Their baked on premises Pies are fantastic. My favorite entrees is the roast Turkey dinner. Real Turkey, real mashed potatoes and edible stuffing. Oh, and the prices are very reasonable.
label: OG

text: This place is GREAT!!  The brisket and ribs are unbelievable. It's great having a bbq place in the area that serves consistently delicious meals. I have been there several times and have been more that impressed with the delicious food and excellent customer service. If you haven't tried bbq bbq yet, do yourself a favor and stop wasting time.
label: OG

text: I had an incredible experience here! Dinner date in a gorgeous restaurant. We had "El Jefe" margaritas to start. I love that they don't use the sweet, syrupy Margarita mix you find at so many restaurants. The drinks were made with Don Julio and had just the right pour of tequila. The complimentary chips and 3 dips (salsa, verde salsa and bean) were incredible. Our server, Samantha, kept the chips coming and we were never empty. She was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and gave us plenty of time to chat over drinks, without the pressure to order right away. Two more margaritas and we decided to share the chorizo stuffed quail from the appetizers.  Top notch! Two managers checked in with us, even though it was fairly busy and actually chatted briefly. Definitely not the usual "required" check in I've seen at many places. Very impressed with the ambience, the food and the service! We'll be coming back again!
label: OG

text: Their food is always good and their customer service is awesome.  I have thrown a bridal shower here and a family thanksgiving here and everyone is always very satisfied.  Their homemade gnocchi is good, I have had better up in bergen county, but this is by far the best homemade gnocchi I have had in south jersey.  Their vegetable pizza is amazing too:) And they are very good with accommodating allergies.
label: OG

text: This is our go to pizza destination.  Sometimes once per week.  Our favorite is the thin crust supreme.  All the flavors really come out.  And, the staff is very friendly and hard working.
label: OG

text: The food is fantastic. Fried avocado wedges were surprisingly good(I'm not a huge avocado fan). My wife's burger(double Major) was awesome, the patties were bigger than the bun (tons of flavor). I got the lamb burger and it was great(I had high expectations too). They take reservations(highly recommended) parking is mall parking $3 if less than 3 hours on weekends. I highly recommend it if you are in the mood for good burgers. They have good selection of beers and wine. They have shakes that supposedly really good, but I went with beer instead. ***they will let you sample Draft beers!!!!!!!** it's casual dress and whole family can enjoy(many children were there).
label: OG

text: Loved every bite! It's always packed and noisy but if you can deal with that its great place to dine.
label: OG

text: Beautiful canyon.  Very scenic and unique.   Highly recommend a trek here.
label: OG

text: Got apps and drinks and it was perfect! Friendly staff/bartenders which made it even better!!
label: OG

text: Have never been disappointed! All the food is great, but the dessert is what you go for. Friendly service always and their private room is also very nice.
label: OG

text: My husband and I just had dinner there. I had seen the reviews, which were good, so we gave it a shot. I am so glad we did, everything was amazing. I had the pork... something (can't remember the name but it started with a B) and my husband had the prime rib. He is a prime rib snob and he said it was delicious, and the pork was so good. The atmosphere is great, it's a small little place, but that adds to the experience. We will definitely be going back, a lot.
label: OG

text: I don't see how anyone would have anything bad to say! This place is literally perfection. The food is hands down delicious & taste homemade. It's family owned & has a really cozy vibe to it. PS: it's BYOB don't forget!!!!
label: OG

text: The Blue Duck's food is always amazing and the service is fantastic. Preferred the old menu, but the new is still delicious.
label: OG

text: K was telling me about the grilled cheese here being good, but I'm a bigger fan of the BLT (who woulda guessed that I would prefer a dish with pig in it?). Also, the housemade chips!I'm reading that the burger is good, so next time, I may try one.Great to have as a late night option.
label: OG

text: Mother's music is a great store. It's not as good as AXE but it is pretty close. It is packed with wall to wall instruments and accessories. The staff is really helpful. They know there stuff and try and get you the best bang for your buck. I mostly enjoyed just browsing and messing around with some of the instruments but if you are actively looking for a new guitar or drum or some other instrument you will be satisfied here. The prices are the same as most music places but the selections better.
label: OG

text: This is hands down the best deep dish pizza in St. Louis. If you don't like dive bars, get it to go.
label: OG

text: I could eat tacos everyday. Love love their veggie tacos and my boyfriend loves the spicy pork tacos. Chips and queso are really good too, just an FYI they top the queso with shredded cheese and tomatoes. Their nachos are also a favorite. Food is always fresh and light, always feel satisfied and not bloated full. Beers in huge chilled goblets are a win too!
label: OG

text: Today was my first time and I was pleasantly pleased.  Sat at the bar.   Was not greeted right away but once she saw me she was very attentive.   The bartender recommended a great local beer...the Honey raspberry.   I ordered the smoked turkey club...WOW!!!   So very good!!!
label: OG

text: Best burritos around! More variety of meats and everything else, too. And the burritos get grilled, not just made on a a steamed tortilla. You'd think this would make them more expensive. Nope. In my experience, this is a little bit cheaper than average. Win-win.
label: OG

text: BEST EVER Culinary Experience I have ever had! on 9/25/2014 & I have travelled to many countries already.....For the non expensive price and only 2 waiters! My husband and I were in food comma for 10hrs! If you haven't you need to go!!!!!  Order everything!!!!! Gnocchi melts in your mouth! taking all my friends here!!!
label: OG

text: I've known about BoConcept for a while, and finally had a chance to get into the store on Chestnut Street. The store in many ways reminds me of H&M. Everything looks pretty good, but has one flaw in the design. I would say that from a design perspective they put more emphasis on form than function. Many of there products look beautiful, but are a pain to interact with. I understand that I am not in Design Within Reach, but the price tags should be more reflective of the quality of the design. In someways, I feel they established a brand, and are riding on it, maybe getting a little lazy.Free espresso though!
label: OG

text: I had the lump crab meat omelette and it was absolutely delicious. It's such a cute spot as well. This is a must try in New Orleans.
label: OG

text: Just had lunch, the 2 for $20 & we were pleasantly surprised. The quality and quantity of the entrees were very impressive (6oz sirloin & Cajun chicken pasta). Best part was our waitress...attentive but not breathing down your neck. Thanks Chili's and thank you Brittney!
label: OG

text: The Monster Minders are THE BEST!I try to be organized, but sometimes I fail.  In a panic I used their 24/7 online booking system to request an afternoon walk for my dog... on a Saturday... with less than 6 hours notice.  Yes, I'm a jerk.Carrie quickly got in touch with my monster's personal minder (shout out to Stephanie).  As I type this from the office I can rest easy knowing Stephanie is taking excellent care of my dog.  I also feel way less guilty for leaving my pup at home since he loooooves Stephanie and will be super thrilled to see her today.  This December  will be my 2 year anniversary with MM and I can honestly say I have never had a single complaint.  They continue to deliver quality care and lighting fast customer service with a smile.
label: OG

text: Great American Playhouse maybe the greatest melodrama theater there is in Arizona! Every actor is incredibly talented! They're funny and engaging. You should come here with any  and all family members. You will have a  great night of entertainment!
label: OG

text: I had been searching for a good dry cleaner in Nashville that does "Green" cleaning (not the chemical PERT which is toxic to me). This cleaner does this type of cleaning and their prices are quite good and turn-around is good as well. You do need to ask for the "Green" cleaning, as they do both types. Friendly and helpful, they did repairs and always have called ahead to ask if I wanted this. All clothes have come back with no odor at all, looking excellent!
label: OG

text: Amazing food (dinner and brunch), amazingly sweet family who owns the restaurant (Kim & Phyllis are the best!); best restaurant on the Main Line with creative dishes and high quality, fresh food. Michael is a wonderful chef and always willing to accommodate meals for customers. Do not leave without dessert; Phyllis makes the BEST desserts, they will never disappoint!   We are regular customers for eat in and take in and they are always so welcoming to us and our young toddlers (since they were babies). Just the BEST!
label: OG

text: I'm so grateful to have found a company that completely takes the worry out of moving. G&G Moving has moved me three times in the past two years: out of a one-bedroom apartment, into a storage unit; out of a storage unit, into a house; out of the house, back to the storage unit. It's a pleasure working with Jessica to begin the move -- her extremely quick, courteous communications set my mind at ease, and she's available on moving day (even on weekends) to help connect with the movers, should any complications arise.It is truly a pleasure to work with Vernon and his staff, so much so that I find myself looking forward to my moving days. While both he and his employees work efficiently and pay careful attention to details, thanks to the flat-rate pricing system, there's never a sense that they're rushing through the job without care; they're always willing to stop for a quick chat or to respond to any questions or worries I might have. Upon arrival, Vernon assesses the amount and type of materials to move, then devises a strategy for packing the truck; on multiple occasions, I've been grateful for his advice about how to pack a tricky object or how to reconfigure an already packed item to avoid causing damage.  Best of all, Vernon works miracles in packing far more than I thought possible into my storage unit; thanks to his awesome spatial intelligence, I'm able to save money each month on a smaller unit. Not a single item has been damaged in any of my moves and, even better, items come out of the storage unit (where they've sat for +6 months) with no damage at all. I would recommend G&G Moving without hesitation -- I'm already looking forward to my next move with them!
label: OG

text: One of the best things we did while my friend was visiting. Went to 5 fun bars (one of them was a shot bar and I conquered the Jell-O shot). We had a superstar tour guide Kinzey who kept it lively with trivia and candid photos and all that good stuff. At the end we got to ride the bull and sing karaoke. Would 10/10 recommend to anyone - locals or tourists!
label: OG

text: I've now been to PokeDoke three times, at various times of day. Initially they were working out some kinks (ran out of fish, 15 min wait for rice) but I have had an excellent meal there every time! I feel like even the small is plenty filling. You get two scoops of fish for the small, which isn't a ton but is enough. You can chose whatever toppings you want, which is awesome! The flavors are great, they are pretty efficient, and the people working there are very nice and friendly. Great addition to the CWE dining scene! Get out of that shake shack line and try Poke Doke instead!
label: OG

text: In Nashville for the weekend, feeling a little finicky food-wise and wanted a good place for some sweet or savory (I hadn't decided yet) brunch food. I found Garden Brunch Cafe through the Yelp app, dragged my two distinctly hungover friends out of bed, and off we went. The restaurant doesn't take reservations, so I had a minor rebellion on my hands when we were told a 35 minute wait...until the hostess told us we could grab a pitcher of mimosas from the (tiny!) back bar and sit on the front porch while waiting. Service so far was exceedingly friendly, from the hostess to the server who took our drink order. The mimosas are heavy on orange juice and light on wine, but still hit the spot for my vitamin-deficient friends.Be aware: when inside the building, the restaurant is close quarters. You don't necessarily feel it while seated, but when standing you feel distinctly cramped with how close the walls, tables, and people are. You have to hug the wall anytime someone wants to pass you. Any less tables and the wait would be longer, so they likely just need to expand to a larger building. The wait took all of that 35 minutes before we were seated by a large window in back. Menu was exactly what I wanted - not a huge selection, but populated with enough interesting choices that we had a hard time deciding. The Banana Foster Pancakes ("a stack of pancakes covered with sautéed caramelized bananas and walnut in a rich buttery sauce, topped with whipped cream") had so many rave Yelp reviews that we wanted to try them, but we ended up being won over by the Butter Pecan Pancakes that came with egg & your choice of meat ($4.50) x2, Salmon Cakes with egg & cheese grits ($4.67), side of potatoes ($1.00), and a side of toast ($.67). Hot tea complemented the meal and was only $1.00.The service lost a little shine after we were seated (not as happy/friendly, waitress had to be reminded of a couple items and still forgot a third until we just had her take it off the bill), but the place was busy the entire time we were there. Food was excellent and no one left hungry. The mimosas seemed overpriced, but we fed 3 hungry people to satiation for less than $20!  We'll definitely be back the next time we visit.
label: OG

text: Food was really good. Service was bad.I had one of the curry meals (I can't remember the name of it... it was the one with string beans and walnuts and I got it with chicken). The food was VERY good. I will definitely come back, but not on a Friday night. There was only one server and she didn't even come to check on us while eating. I had to ask the food runner for more water, and he gave cashed us out! Also- they will only take credit card if you spend over $25. The soup with shrimp was really really tasty too. Come on Siamese Princess! Get your service together! Hire another server or something!! You would've gotten 5/5 starts!
label: OG

text: I just had the Margherita Pizza  $11.50&up   OrderSlices of ripe tomato topped with fresh basil, olive oil, oregano and Parmigiana cheese. and wow, that was a good pizza.... exceeded my expectations... will definitely be back... nice atmosphere as well... can't wait to take the lady out for some wine and pie... :)

text: Decent service. Food was bland. I'll probably find somewhere else to go next time. It seemed really slow so I'm. It sure if that is indicative of the service or food.

text: This place is delicious!  There are so many flavors that are made in house. Everyone was friendly and we tried several flavors. The mangonada was spicy, sweet, tangy and delicious!  We also tried pistachio and coconut. Two enthusiastic thumbs up!  We will be back.

text: the new food menu is still awesome for the price.  i recently tried the grilled cheese sandwich burger and it was pretty good.  the grilled cheese sandwich part could have used some more cheese, but overall delicious.  the special sauce was really tastey and i recommend asking for an extra side of it to load on the burger.

text: Loved this spot! My first time eating Afghan food and I look forward to coming back. The Narange Palow is the yellow plate in the photo served with lamb. It's cooked in rose water which makes it taste sweeter than regular rice. Reservations are not important, just walk in and enjoy!

text: Terrible place. Terrible service. Terrible customers. Terrible employees. Shut it down.

text: We came here on a Tuesday night. Not busy at all. My boyfriend went to the bar to get a vodka Red Bull. She poured the vodka and then poured out of a ROCKSTAR energy drink can that I saw her drink out of  multiple times. I just want to know why she thought this was ok and why this was allowed.

text: Back home for a few days and trying to catch up with a lot of folks. I really didn't feel like thinking so I actually had 2 meals here in one day then drinks later in the night then returned the next day for lunch.I sat at the bar one of the times and thought the bartender was helpful and nice and enjoyed the artichoke dip and the pad thai.Later I returned with a book, alone, and sat at a little table for a glass of red and a burger.  I enjoyed the other patrons who were friendly and the servers left me to myself, which I like.  I returned the next day for what I thought would be a big lunch but had 4 adults and 3 little kids and they are the only ones who ordered anything except for a few glasses of wine.  translation: small bill for 3 girls under 10 to trash a table and our server could not have been nicer.  The mac and cheese took about 40 min which is crazy but they gave us two orders for free and I explained to the 5 year old that they had run out of princess mac and cheese so they had to wait to get her the little pot to make it special.  She could not have been happier and with a wink from me the waiter totally played along.  The kids liked their fries and burger and juices.  Def. worth checking out and you can always go next store to sweet stuff for desert:)

text: We weren't all that impressed with the shop. It was more than my coffee at Starbucks which I would have preferred. The atmosphere was trendy and industrial looking.

text: Most amazing deli ever. Sandwichs are mind blowing.  Every week my boyfriend & I go, we always get the daily special & a regular sandwich off the menu. The "Roberto", "Benton Park", "Mike's Beef & Cheddar", & "Turkey Supreme" are my top 4 favs. All DELICIOUS. Great little spot & staff is the best. Definitely A+++

text: I've been here a few times for book signings and to look around.  I find the store difficult to navigate, and there is no seating area for book signings or even much room to have them. Tried to sell some books or at least find out what their interests were. Followed the protocol I was given by a staff member, and the buyer wasn't rude but unhelpful. You can be courteous even if you are not interested. Glad others feel Haslam's is a great find; I'm lukewarm.

text: We went for lunch today. Service was too slow for anyone on a lunch break (it took nearly an hour). There wasn't a lunch menu, so we paid dinner prices for dinner portions. I saw a little section of "fast plates". I forget what it was called, but none of those items really jumped out at me. We ordered fish tacos, beef tacos with Korean BBQ and fries. It was all good. This might be a better place for dinner.

text: The food is excellent, the seating is comfortable with plenty of room, the prices are cheap, and the service is adequate. The delicious, freshly cooked salmon embedded in a salad was only $11 for dinner. If you order this dish, ask for extra tomatoes (they tend to skimp on them).
label: OG

text: Came here for breakfast during my Nola trip. - Dark meat fried chicken (5/5 stars) - #1. Omg this fried chicken!! Best fried chicken I've had. Sadly, I haven't had fried chicken at too many legit places but better late than never! (Don't let the simple look of the chicken in my picture fool you... It will blow your mind!)- Shrimp grillades/shrimp n grits (3/5 stars): Hmm... the shrimp were very tiny and not satisfying. The entire bowl was lacking flavor. Later I was yelping Luke's and saw how big their shrimps are... (unfortunately didn't get the chance to go to Luke's)- White meat fried chicken (2/5 stars); Awww. I guess white meat is healthier but boy was it dry. No good :(- Fried catfish (4/5 stars): Only had a bite of this - snatched a bite from friend's order. Tasted very delicious and fresh!Service was so friendly. Seems like a local's spot, and all the waiters/waitresses were genuinely sweet. So rare these days to find this type of relaxed, happy service that's not just overbearing and looking for extra tips... so it's always a nice surprise finding it!Overall, it's a decent spot for food in New Orleans. But it was only 2 blocks walking distance from our Air BnB spot so the convenience was helpful. (We were recommended to Li'l Dizzy's by our uber driver one night)
label: OG

text: Fun atmosphere, and food.  Sat outside on the patio, live jazz and margaritas.  Mixed menu with Latin flavor.  Had a really great steak, pulled pork tamale, fresh guacamole and chips...large portions.  Would definitely return!

text: My daughter had her wedding her.  Fantastic setting, great people, easy to work with and the food was wonderful.  We looked at many venues and glad we choose Tucson Country Club.

text: Fantastic!  Staff was amazingly friendly.   The restaurant is super cute.   Ambiance is chill with a dash of artsy and a Hawaiian vibe. We had a hard time ordering since there were so many entrées that sounded good.  Plus,  there were a couple daily specials.   We started off with a refreshing goat cheese and beet salad.   Then chose the huli huli chicken, tacos and steak plate special.   All of the entrees were terrific.   The iced tea infused with pineapple was awesome too! We couldn't be more pleased with this restaurant.  Highly recommend!
label: OG

text: Awesome food, very fresh and Weill prepared.  Best service of all the Nashville Thai restaurants I have tried.
label: OG

text: Terrible Customer service! It must be a Yankee Thing. Called weeks in advance to make reservations. Called two weeks later to confirm reservations just to find out ( The goofed up and booked the wrong rooms). After being promised 2 suites and the person on the phone insulted the last person to book us, we were assured that the problem was corrected. After arriving at the Hotel from a long journey, we were shown to our rooms. Guess what? They weren't the suites we were promised. After waiting in the hall way for an hour, we were finally ushered in to a suite room. Guess what? after moving our gear into the new room, we just wanted to verify the price we were paying. Guess what? She doubled the price on us. Yes, Doubled it. They used to call this game "Bait and Switch". We declined the rooms and after moving back to the old rooms, We received NO APOLOGIES, Not even a thank you. We did get nasty looks from the manager. The Floor staff however, were sympathetic and very nice. This hotel was supposed to have been recently renovated. The rooms really look poor. The wall paper looks like amateurs hung it. I moved the couch to find the floors dirty. To kick it all off, My friend left 2 bathing suits behind. The staff said they would hold them for him. He drove an hour to get back up their only to have to wait for the manager to finish her cigarette, then was told that she didn't have a key to where his bathing suits were being held. No one had a key? Come on. They obviously didn't like my honest survey sheet that I turned in. Suggestion: There are better places for less money in the area with Fast, Friendly, Service!
label: OG

text: I live in Philly but I decided to go here after seeing a show at the Media Theatre with a friend. I must say that everything that we ordered was amazing. We ordered the fried mozzarella (who knew that mozzarella cheese wrapped in a spring roll wrapper was sooo good?!) as an appetizer, she ordered the chicken Marsala and I had the pasta in vodka sauce with added grilled chicken and creme brûlée cheesecake and coffee for dessert. This was the best Italian food I've had in a while and we will surely be back!
label: OG

text: What a crap hole! I'm shocked that a publicly traded high profile grocery store would just let themselves go like this.  You walk in and their's the stench of death ... that's the rotting meat from the strange looking butcher who talks to himself.OMG and the Deli! Yikes!  No service! When there is someone there they look like an escapee from the funny farm who forgot their meds that day.DON'T use the restroom! You'd be safer crapping out back behind the store, it wreaks of mood and funky stench.  Bright points however. Some of the cashiers are very helpful and friendly but you get the overall feeling that NOBODY is happy with management ... I can see why.The produce department is pretty good I have to say and the guys how run it do a decent job of keeping it stocked and clean.Frozen foods could use some help ... I couldn't even get a simple bag of Carrots & Pea's.Overall the store needs a GOOD DEEP CLEANING and is really too small to service their community ... they don't even have their own pharmacy.  You have to drive across the street and risk your life at the stupid intersection ...I would prefer to have a 1 stop shop and for that reason I generally go to Costco if I'm going to have to get in my car in the first place.
label: OG

text: Just had my First class there this past Saturday. I'm going again this Wednesday, probably again this coming Sunday, and have scheduled a group ride for  my athletes at the strength and conditioning facility I own. Jamie and her staff have the energy, drive, and passion that make their cycling studio the best in Tampa Bay, hands down. Their instructors are top notch, well trained, and a blast to work with. During my first class the instructor (Cisco) said hello to almost every rider in the class, and even gave me a shout out midway through the ride to welcome me to the studio. Not to mention his class was awesome. This place has it dialed in. Go there. Don't think about it, just do it.
label: OG

text: Our tour guide from the Road Scholar tour told us that BBQ shrimp was a "must" while we were in New Orleans.  It was conveniently located across from the Hotel Monteleone where we were staying.  Reservations are a must!  We were seated promptly and the service was very good.  We started with the Jumbo Sea Scallops for an appetizer and unfortunately did not read the menu thoroughly.  It was two scallops for $15.  They were excellent, but a bit pricey and very difficult to share 6 ways. 4 out of the 6 of us had the BBQ shrimp and it was truly delicious!  One had the bacon wrapped shrimp & grits.  It was fabulous!  One had the wood grilled fish and thought it was just okay.  It really didn't hold a candle to the other dishes.  We shared a chocolate molten cup cake for dessert and it was really yummy!!!  Tasted like more!
label: OG

text: Don't let the name of this restaurant fool you. This is my second time coming to I Love Salad and both times I haven't had a salad. On both trips I have gotten the Hot Bowl Bulgogi. Why? Because it is absolutely amazing; and today did not disappoint once again. The bowl comes out extremely hot (I don't even know how they do it) and the broth is bubbling filled with noodles, vegetables, tofu, bulgogi beef, and other delicious ingredients. All of these ingredients are amazing and taste wonderful, but the best part about this dish is the broth. This broth is out of this world. It's hard to describe, but it is spicy, salty, sour... you just have to go try the broth. I Love Salad is an awesome restaurant; I haven't tried their salads, but I am sure they are great based off of the amazing Korean food that they are serving. This place is amazing and I highly recommend going. They also have a great green tea bubble tea that I have gotten the past two times, which is a great palate cleanser after the meal.
label: OG

text: worst Thai food I have ever had.  the first restaurant I have been to that screwed up fried rice. It was soggy!  Then I ordered the mahi-mahi special..they didnt have mahi mahi..they replaced it with some fish that was cooked poorly.(21.95)  Lastly the narberth jungle with jumbo tiger shrimp was actually regular shrimp from acme.  (18.95)Summary.  Overpriced, bad food.  Avoid this place!

text: Cancelled appointments on me twice. Wasted 10 hours of my life. No thank you.

text: They installed our AC.  What a poor job!  They put in 2 AC vents in 2 rooms that didn't have vents  and instead of putting in the farthest part of the room from the rest of the house, they put them closest to the rest of the house which means that there is no air flow to most of the room.  I questioned them on this choice and they assured me that it was best to put them where they wanted.  I sadly trusted their "professional" judgement.They also chose not to walk on the beams over the ceiling in one of the rooms and cracked the cement the ceiling in one of the rooms and made the fan/light fixture fall off it's mount. In addition, they placed the pipe that collects and routes any condensation water away from the unit such that it leaked into our utility room instead of outside.  What a fiasco!!! On top of everything else they recommended a unit too small for our house. Not happy!  Luckily, we found American Conditioned Air and they helped us remediate most of the problems.  They are a 5 star company! We love them!
label: OG

text: Nail tek is definitely the best salon in the area....by far!!!  I won't even consider going elsewhere.  And, there's a reason for this.....the owners and their staff work very hard to provide the best services imaginable for their clients---they will always go above and beyond and their pricing is more than fair!   In the past, I drove to a nearby town for services and paid a great deal more, but why...when the very best is close by.

text: I have been a huge honeygrow fan for a few years now, but I'm struggling to like them as much as I did in the past. Service is good, food is good, but this new menu has got to go. They took away my favorite salad dressing (citrus basil caeser), my favorite salad topping (candied cashews), and my favorite stir fry sauce (lemon miso).  I am also gluten free and they took away in my opinion the only good gluten free sauce on the menu, without adding another one.  I love honeygrow, but I hate this new menu.

text: Review of bathroom only.  No soap.  Had to ask for toilet paper and paper towels, bathroom felt gross but we really needed to use the amenities as gross as it was after a long drive passing through.   Gas I rate 5 star since it was $3.19 today (August 2012) and last time I pumped was $3.39

text: I love this place-- not just because it's basically around the corner from my house. As a graduate student, the student wax packages are a great way for me to save $$. And the wax they use is much gentler on my skin than traditional wax-- I never break out in a rash like I used to when I got waxed elsewhere.Honestly though, the reason I keep going back is definitely Cat. She's been doing my brows/lip for quite some time now and it's awesome to see how my brows have transformed! She brought out their natural shape, AND she taught me how to fill them in so they look even more flawless. I get compliments on them ALL the time. Not only is she efficient and thorough, but she's really funny and kind, and I always look forward to my appointments with her. Was tickled to see she got a well-deserved mention in Philly Mag! Thanks for being awesome, Cat :)
label: OG

text: The Rooms are nice and the place is clean and it is an historic landmark right in the middle of the French Quarter.  Get a 2nd floor Balcony room facing Bourbon St if you want to experience Bourbon St from above.  Get a courtyard room if you want to have a little more peace and quiet.

text: This is a great place to go if you live in the city and have kids. The wait-list is waaaaaay too long though, so we usually go as guests of friends of ours who belong.You also can't bring food in - so know that, too.

text: Love the bread from here.  They have a nice variety of organic breads and treats.  The service is fast and friendly. The breads are a tad expensive and they don't take visa but they are much better quality then bread you will find at major grocery stores.

text: This is a heart attack in a box, which usually means great tasting food. It does here. Fried chicken, Shrimp. Gizzards, Chicken Livers, Fish "and steak fingers too," as the  commercial jingle goes. ( A jingle you'll never get out of your head once  when you hear it.)  All succulent and flavorful. We love the fries, slaw and garlic toast too.  EVERTHING is a joy to eat, even if you have to pay later. The original family recipes from 1953 are still l  followed. This location is their first location in  Tucson. #1, but there are now 8 locations in Tucson. This place is #1 indeed.
label: OG

text: Pretty decent in comparison to west coast poke. Ingredients were fresh and plentiful. The portion size are perfect for both sizes.

text: I have to admit the reviews brought me to this place but when I saw the location I was skeptical at first. It's  nestled right next to a couple strip clubs. While the location isn't its strong suit once you taste a slice you forget all about it. This pizza had some of the best cheese I've ever had on a pie. The crust had that perfect amount of chew that you're looking for. Not wet and doughy and not that cardboard stuff you get for $5. Overall I'd say if you're looking to feed just yourself go for the single slices, if you're looking to feed a family order a whole. You can't go wrong either way.

text: Beautiful hotel. Great location. Really would love a bottle of water in my room or the ability to buy it somewhere in the hotel. Would have given 5 Stars BUT am dying for water after a Nola night and the staff at front is beyond (!) rude and patronizing telling you to walk 20 feet down outside for a bottle of water. I said I'd love to buy water and I don't care the price but they are lazy and make you feel awful. Horrible when you spend hundreds a night to feel like you are inconveniencing people.

text: I promised the owner that I would try Thai 5 again. I had a little better experience this time, and have adjusted my review a bit. However, I still think the place needs work. For example, fresh rolls should not fall apart as you pick them up. The food quantity was better, but I still think it lacks zing.

text: Atmosphere is amazing.  What a great concept.  Perfect for a low key evening. Wonderful wine.  Beautiful music.

text: The only item we order here is the Banh Mi. If the woman makes it, it usually very full and great. If the man makes it, it will be skimpy on filling. Either way, it is a good Banh Mi for a reasonable price.

text: Had some of the specialty rolls. They were soooo good! My new sushi spot AND there's occasional Groupons for this place!

text: One fish, two fish. Raw fish, cooked fish.We walked in for dinnerand they asked us to wait.We asked "for how long?"they stared with a blank on their face.Habachi tables were open and plentythe booths are not.So the wait for a tablecould be a long shot.Patiently we wait for the an answer or a guessThen they shoot out 20 minutes at best.25 minutes later we are called up to eat.The initial experience already spells defeat.Service at the table was friendly and kindThe food was ok not the best that I've hadFried banana dessert however, did blow my mind. Not sure I'd come backbased on the wait.The food was lacklusterin the department of taste.

text: Our whole family has had gelato in Italy several times and Frost is as authentic as it gets. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the coffee is also very good. Wish we had a Frost in our home town!

text: Great small Italian restaurant. Can get tight and busy, but the food is amazing. Great date spot!

text: Had a bad first experience despite the positive reviews.  Pros: They had three different coffee roasts to choose from, the staff was friendly, the food was hot, and the prices on the menu were very reasonable.  Also, they had a big screen TV playing NFL which was great!Cons: They made us wait for a table for ten minutes even though there were at least 4 tables open within eyesight (not sure if this was some policy or another reason they did this), the skillet I ordered was pretty decent tasting but consisted of about 40% broccoli which seemed like an odd food to include in a breakfast skillet, we never received drinking water, and I was hoping to get some coffee creamer (because I saw the awesome selection they had at various other tables) but the waitress was too busy.I will say that this place was packed during the time I visited and that excuses a bit of the lack of service, but as for the food, not good enough to return for me.
label: OG

text: Stumbled across this unassuming-looking little joint, but very glad I did. Granted, I've only eaten there once, but I have to say: Averaging out the price, portions and quality - I'm giving it 5 stars. They only serve breakfast (anytime) and lunch, and close at 4PM. Burgers, sandwiches, salads, po boys make up the rest of the menu. I had the red beans & rice platter, with "loaded" potato soup and a side of mac & cheese. FYI, the beans & rice also had a full sausage (cut halfway lengthwise) plus a mound of rice in the middle & chopped herbs on top.  All this for under $7? Hell yes. I was stuffed & feeling good walking out. They tell me all their meals have equally generous portions too. The owner says they're only about a year with the business & still dialing in their menu, etc. Hopefully they won't mess up a good thing - at least with the red beans & rice.
label: OG

text: This place is pretty good for the suburbs. They have a ton of choices on their menu so you should be able to find something you want to try. The thing I like most about this place is that the sauces are not overwhelming. Some other places drench the food in this one brown sauce that everyone seems to have. The food should taste good without a huge heaping of sauce and this place does that well.
label: OG

text: Came here for their gourmet donuts. Apparently this is one of the few places near Pinellas Park and in St. Petes that has gourmet or fun donuts.When I went, it was around 1pm and there were still a lot of good options left.  We had: Peanut Butter and Jelly, Chocolate Glazed, Chocolate peanut, Chocolate Cream,  Fruit Loops donut and Coco puffs donut.I enjoyed them all. The chocolate cream had some kinda sweet crumble on top with a cream inside. For the cereal ones, you gotta buy em early. As the day goes in, the cereal starts to lose its crunch.They also have their own homemade cream cheese spreads that they make, including Honey Walnut Raisin, Strawberry, Lox, Honey Butter, Chives and more (see pic).They also have a lot of coffee flavors and bagel flavours.Its a small shop and it's a good size to bring a friend or two along, but too small for a bigger group. I recommend this place
label: OG

text: Frozen.Cafe.Au.Lait.This is a great place to chat with friends over coffee and beignets. (the beignets are not as good as morning call, but the coffee is much better.
